name: µmol/l
definition: A unit of molarity which is equal to one millionth of a molar or 10^[-6] mol/L

name: Degrees
definition: A plane angle unit which is equal to 1/360 of a full rotation or 1.7453310^[-2] rad.

name: Ml/l
definition: Milliliters per liter. A volume per unit volume unit which is equal to one millionth of a liter of solute in one liter of solution.

name: Individual Count
definition: The number of individuals represented present at the time of the Occurrence.

name: δ13c
definition: Carbon 13 isotopic signature. Enrichment or deficiency of the proportion of C13 isotope in a carbon source, relative to a standard proportion of 0.0112372 (found in the fossil source Pee Dee Belemnite). Expressed in per mil (‰). (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%CE%9413C)

name: Trophic dependence
definition: Specifies the category of energy source upon which an organism relies for nutritional energy. eg: light, inorganic chemical energy, organic matter, multiple sources.

name: Heterotrophic
definition: Deriving energy from consuming organic matter. Pure heterotrophic organisms contain no functioning plastids or photosynthetic pigments, and show evidence for consumption of organic particles or prey. (Barton, AD, Finkel, ZV, Ward, BA, Johns, DG, Follows, MJ. 2013. On the roles of cell size and trophic strategy in North Atlantic diatom and dinoflagellate communities. Limnol. Oceanogr., 58(1), 2013, 254–266. doi:10.4319/lo.2013.58.1.0254)

name: Photoautotrophic
definition: Deriving energy from light sources. In practice, taxa containing plastids and photosynthetic pigments, but with no evidence for consumption of organic particles or prey, are considered to be photoautotrophic. (Barton, AD, Finkel, ZV, Ward, BA, Johns, DG, Follows, MJ. 2013. On the roles of cell size and trophic strategy in North Atlantic diatom and dinoflagellate communities. Limnol. Oceanogr., 58(1), 2013, 254–266. doi:10.4319/lo.2013.58.1.0254)

name: Mixotrophic
definition: Deriving energy from more than one category of energy source. eg: light energy and organic matter.

name: Diatom symmetry type
definition: a traditional division of the Bacillariophyceae or diatoms into two groups based upon symmetry (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diatom#Classification)

name: Pennate
definition: diatoms which are bilaterally symmetrical (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diatom#Classification)

name: Centric
definition: diatoms which are radially symmetrical (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diatom#Classification)

name: µm^3
definition: A volume unit which is equal to 10^[-15] liters

name: µm^2
definition: An area unit which is equal to 10^[-12] square meters

name: µm^(-1)
definition: A reciprocal length unit which is equal to 10^[-6] meters^[-1]

name: Prism on elliptic base
definition: A cell shape that approximates a prism on an elliptic base. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Cylinder
definition: A cell shape that approximates a cylinder. (Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II)

name: Cymbelloid
definition: A cell shape that approximates a cymbelloid. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Cone + half sphere + cylinder
definition: A cell shape that approximates a cone + half sphere + cylinder. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Rectangular box
definition: A cell shape approximating a rectangular box. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Prism on triangle base
definition: A cell shape approximating a prism on a triangle base. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Half-elliptic prism
definition: A cell shape approximating a half-elliptic prism. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Elliptic prism + 4 cones
definition: A cell shape approximating an elliptic prism + 4 cones. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Cylinder + 2 half spheres
definition: A cell shape that approximates a cylinder + 2 half spheres. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Prism on parallelo-gram base
definition: A cell shape that approximates a prism on a parallelo-gram base. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Elliptic prism with transapical constriction
definition: A cell shape that approximates an elliptic prism with a transapical constriction. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Prism on triangle base
definition: A cell shape that approximates a prism on triangle base, (girdle view, triangle height not visible). Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Sickle-shaped prism
definition: A cell shape that approximates a sickle-shaped prism. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Gomphonemoid
definition: A cell shape that approximates a gomphonemoid. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: 2 cylinders + ellipitic prism
definition: A cell shape that approximates 2 cylinders + an ellipitic prism. Sun, J. and Liu, D. 2003. Geometric models for calculating cell biovolume and surface area for phytoplankton, J. Plankton Res., 25, 1331–1346, doi:10.1093/plankt/fbg096, Table II

name: Cell minArea/minVolume
definition: ratio of Minimum Cell Surface Area to Minimum Cell Volume.
attribution: (Leblanc, K., Arístegui, J., Armand, L., Assmy, P., Beker, B., Bode, A., Breton, E., Cornet, V., Gibson, J., Gosselin, M.-P., Kopczynska, E., Marshall, H., Peloquin, J., Piontkovski, S., Poulton, A. J., Quéguiner, B., Schiebel, R., Shipe, R., Stefels, J., van Leeuwe, M. A., Varela, M., Widdicombe, C., and Yallop, M.: A global diatom database – abundance, biovolume and biomass in the world ocean, Earth Syst. Sci. Data Discuss., 5, 147-185, doi:10.5194/essdd-5-147-2012, 2012.)

name: Cell maxArea/maxVolume
definition: ratio of Maximum Cell Surface Area to Maximum Cell Volume.
attribution: Leblanc, K., Arístegui, J., Armand, L., Assmy, P., Beker, B., Bode, A., Breton, E., Cornet, V., Gibson, J., Gosselin, M.-P., Kopczynska, E., Marshall, H., Peloquin, J., Piontkovski, S., Poulton, A. J., Quéguiner, B., Schiebel, R., Shipe, R., Stefels, J., van Leeuwe, M. A., Varela, M., Widdicombe, C., and Yallop, M.: A global diatom database – abundance, biovolume and biomass in the world ocean, Earth Syst. Sci. Data Discuss., 5, 147-185, doi:10.5194/essdd-5-147-2012, 2012.

name: Percent species currently described
definition: percent of all marine species in this clade that are currently described (estimate) (Appeltans et al. 2012. The Magnitude of Global Marine Species Diversity. Current Biology 22, 2189–2202. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2012.09.036)

name: Percent synonyms
definition: percent of all marine species names in this clade that are considered subjective synonyms (Appeltans et al. 2012. The Magnitude of Global Marine Species Diversity. Current Biology 22, 2189–2202. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2012.09.036)

name: Described (accepted)
definition: number of currently described and taxonomically accepted species in this clade (Appeltans et al. 2012. The Magnitude of Global Marine Species Diversity. Current Biology 22, 2189–2202. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2012.09.036)

name: Number of new species decribed 1999-2008
definition: number of new species published between 1999 and 2008 (Appeltans et al. 2012. The Magnitude of Global Marine Species Diversity. Current Biology 22, 2189–2202. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2012.09.036)

name: Known marine species
definition: number of currently described and taxonomically accepted species in this clade (Appeltans et al. 2012. The Magnitude of Global Marine Species Diversity. Current Biology 22, 2189–2202. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2012.09.036)

name: Total species (expert opinion)
definition: total estimated number of species in this clade (known + undescribed + undiscovered) (estimate based on expert opinion) (Appeltans et al. 2012. The Magnitude of Global Marine Species Diversity. Current Biology 22, 2189–2202. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2012.09.036)

name: Total unknown species (expert opinion)
definition:
Total species unknown in this clade (undescribed + undiscovered) (estimate based on
expert opinion) (Appeltans et al. 2012. The Magnitude of Global Marine Species Diversity. Current Biology 22, 2189–2202. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2012.09.036)"

name: Total unknown species (statistical model)
definition: total species unknown in this clade (estimate based on a statistical model) (Appeltans et al. 2012. The Magnitude of Global Marine Species Diversity. Current Biology 22, 2189–2202. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2012.09.036)

name: Undescribed species present in museum collections
definition: "species in this clade which are currently represented in specimen collections (estimate) (Appeltans et al. 2012. The Magnitude of Global Marine Species Diversity. Current Biology 22, 2189–2202. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2012.09.036)"

name: Undiscovered morphospecies (not yet collected)
definition: unsampled and undiscovered morphospecies in this clade (estimate) (Appeltans et al. 2012. The Magnitude of Global Marine Species Diversity. Current Biology 22, 2189–2202. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2012.09.036)

name: Undiscovered species (molecular cryptic)
definition: undiscovered molecular cryptic species in this clade (only distinguishable by molecular methods) (estimate) (Appeltans et al. 2012. The Magnitude of Global Marine Species Diversity. Current Biology 22, 2189–2202. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2012.09.036)

name: Percent surveyed species not yet known to science
definition: percent of undescribed species in this clade, found in this survey (Appeltans et al. 2012. The Magnitude of Global Marine Species Diversity. Current Biology 22, 2189–2202. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2012.09.036)

name: Surface deposit feeder
definition: An organism which obtains food primarily by surface deposit feeding. Reid WDK, Wigham BD, McGill RAR, Polunin NVC (2012) Elucidating trophic pathways in benthic deep-sea assemblages of the Mid-Atlantic Ridge north and south of the Charlie-Gibbs Fracture Zone. Mar Ecol Prog Ser 463:89-103. doi:10.3354/meps09863

name: Suspension feeder
definition: An organism which obtains food primarily by suspension feeding. Reid WDK, Wigham BD, McGill RAR, Polunin NVC (2012) Elucidating trophic pathways in benthic deep-sea assemblages of the Mid-Atlantic Ridge north and south of the Charlie-Gibbs Fracture Zone. Mar Ecol Prog Ser 463:89-103. doi:10.3354/meps09863

name: Predator
definition: An organism which obtains food primarily by predation. Reid WDK, Wigham BD, McGill RAR, Polunin NVC (2012) Elucidating trophic pathways in benthic deep-sea assemblages of the Mid-Atlantic Ridge north and south of the Charlie-Gibbs Fracture Zone. Mar Ecol Prog Ser 463:89-103. doi:10.3354/meps09863

name: Predator–scavenger
definition: An organism which obtains food primarily by predation +scavenging. Reid WDK, Wigham BD, McGill RAR, Polunin NVC (2012) Elucidating trophic pathways in benthic deep-sea assemblages of the Mid-Atlantic Ridge north and south of the Charlie-Gibbs Fracture Zone. Mar Ecol Prog Ser 463:89-103. doi:10.3354/meps09863

name: Trophic guild
definition: A group of species that exploit the same food resources, and/or use the same feeding or foraging methods. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guild_(ecology)

name: δ15n
definition: Nitrogen 15 isotopic signature. Enrichment or deficiency of the proportion of N15 isotope in a nitrogen source, relative to a standard proportion of 0.003663033 (found in air). Expressed in per mil (‰). (http://sisbl.uga.edu/stable.html#notate)

name: δ34s
definition: Sulfur 34 isotopic signature. Enrichment or deficiency of the proportion of S34 isotope in a sulfur source, relative to a standard proportion of 0.0441626 (found in the Canyon Diablo troilite). Expressed in per mil (‰). (http://isonumbers.weizmann.ac.il/bionumber.aspx?&id=100252&ver=12)

name: Feeds on
definition: consumes for energetic or other nutritional needs
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Predator

name: Interacts with
definition: an organism has an effect on another organism in the community.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecological_interaction

name: Hosts
definition: provides some resource to a symbiont, either commensal, parasitic or mutualistic
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Host_(biology); http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symbiosis

name: Preys upon
definition: consumes for energetic or other nutritional needs (object of consumption is an organism)
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Predator

name: Has host
definition: derives some resource as a symbiont, either commensal, parasitic or mutualistic
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Host_(biology); http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symbiosis

name: Pollinates
definition: moves pollen from the male anthers of a flower to the female stigma of a flower to accomplish fertilization.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pollinator

name: Has pollinator
definition: moves pollen from the male anthers of a flower to the female stigma of a flower to accomplish fertilization.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pollination

name: Is found on
definition: has been observed or reported in physical contact with

name: Parasitizes
definition: non-mutual relationship between organisms of different species where one organism, the parasite, benefits at the expense of the other, the host.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parasitism

name: Has parasite
definition: non-mutual relationship between organisms of different species where one organism, the parasite, benefits at the expense of the other, the host.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parasitism

name: Mm
definition: Millimeter. A length unit which is equal to one thousandth of a meter or 10^[-3] m

name: G
definition: Grams. A mass unit which is equal to one thousandth of a kilogram or 10^[-3] kg.

name: M
definition: Meters. A length unit which is equal to the length of the path traveled by light in vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second.

name: Range midpoint latitude
definition: The angular distance, north or south of the earth's equator, of the midpoint of the known geographic range of an organism.

name: Temperature at range midpoint latitude
definition: The temperature at the range midpoint latitude of an organism.

name: Tarsometatarsus + middle toe length
definition: Length of the tarsometatarsus + length of the middle toe.

name: Tarsus length
definition: length of the tarsus

name: Middle toe length
definition: length of the middle toe

name: Midpoint altitude
definition: Elevation above sea level of the midpoint of the vertical range of an organism.

name: Bill length
definition: Length of the bill.

name: Rich EOL page?
definition: at least one page in this clade with richness>=0.4 on eol

name: Number of specimens in GGBN
definition: number of records in this clade in the Global Genome Biodiversity Network (GGBN) repository of genome quality tissues.

name: Specimens in GGBN?
definition: this clade is represented by specimens in the Global Genome Biodiversity Network (GGBN)

name: Records in GBIF?
definition: this clade is represented by geo-referenced data in the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF)

name: Sequences in GenBank?
definition: this clade is represented by gene sequences in GenBank

name: Number of sequences in GenBank
definition: number of sequences for taxa in this clade in GenBank

name: Number of rich pages on EOL
definition: number of species in this clade with richness >= 0.4 on EOL

name: Number of images on EOL
definition: number of images of taxa in this clade on EOL

name: Number of articles on EOL
definition: number of articles for taxa in this clade on EOL

name: Number of media on EOL
definition: number of images+videos+audio files of taxa in this clade on EOL

name: Number of records in GBIF
definition: number of records for taxa in this clade in the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF)

name: Yes
definition: This statement is true; the answer to this question is yes.

name: No
definition: This statement is false; the answer to this question is no.

name: Unknown
definition: This statement may be true or false; the answer to this question is unknown.

name: Diapause initiation
definition: Lifestage at which Diapause is initiated; i.e.: morphological development ceases.(http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diapause#Initiation)

name: Copepodid stage 3
definition: The third post-naupliar life stage of a copepod. All copepodid stages are characterised by two pairs of unsegmented swimming appendages, and an unsegmented "hind-body" comprising the thorax and the abdomen. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copepodid#Copepoda)

name: Copepodid stage 4
definition: The fourth post-naupliar life stage of a copepod. All copepodid stages are characterised by two pairs of unsegmented swimming appendages, and an unsegmented "hind-body" comprising the thorax and the abdomen. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copepodid#Copepoda)

name: Copepodid stage 5
definition: The fifth post-naupliar life stage of a copepod. All copepodid stages are characterised by two pairs of unsegmented swimming appendages, and an unsegmented "hind-body" comprising the thorax and the abdomen. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copepodid#Copepoda)

name: Egg stage
definition: The first post-fertilization life stage of many organisms. The developing organism is enclosed by a membrane and possibly a hard shell and is not yet motile. Followed by hatching and either larval or other juvenile life stages.

name: Ev
definition: Electronvolt. A non-SI unit of energy (eV) defined as the energy acquired by a single unbound electron when it passes through an electrostatic potential difference of one volt. An electronvolt is equal to 1.602 176 53(14) x 10^-19 J.

name: E(development)
definition: the activation energy required for the metabolic processes involved in development. (Maps, F., Pershing, A.J. & Record, N.R. (2011). A generalized approach for simulating growth and development in diverse marine copepod species. ICES J. Mar. Sci., 69, 370–379.)

name: Generation frequency
definition: in population biology, the number of generations of offspring born during an interval. Reciprocal of generation time (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generation_time)

name: Zooplankton feeding mode
definition: behavior by which zooplankton obtain food; ambush, feeding current, or cruising. (Barton, AD, Pershing, AJ, Litchman, E, Record, NR, Edwards, KF, Finkel, ZV, Kiørboe, T, Ward, BA. 2013. The biogeography of marine plankton traits. Ecology Letters (2013) 16: 522–534. DOI: 10.1111/ele.12063)

name: Ambush
definition: An organism which obtains food primarily by ambush predation.

name: Feeding current
definition: An organism which obtains food primarily by utilizing a feeding current.

name: Cruising
definition: An organism which obtains food primarily by foraging while cruising.

name: Geographical zone
definition: Broad geographical regions separated by latitude. Polar, subpolar, temperate, subtropical, tropical, boreal, arctoboreal, cosmopolitan, etc.

name: Pg
definition: picogram. A mass unit which is equal to 10^[-12] g

name: G/cm^3
definition: Grams per cubic centimeter. A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in grams divided by the volume in cubic centimeters.

name: Wetland
definition: An area that is inundated or saturated by surface or ground water at a frequency and duration sufficient to support, and that under normal circumstances do support, a prevalence of vegetation typically adapted for life in saturated soil conditions.

name: Cliff
definition: A high, steep, or overhanging face of rock.

name: Woodland
definition: Land having a cover of trees, shrubs, or both.

name: Field
definition: An area of land, usually relatively small, enclosed or otherwise and used for agricultural purposes.

name: Plantation
definition: An intentional planting of a crop, on a large scale, usually for uses other than cereal production or pasture. The term is currently most often used for plantings of trees and shrubs. The term tends also to be used for plantings maintained on economic bases other than that of subsistence farming.

name: Stream bank
definition: The sloping margin of a stream, serving to confine it to its natural channel.

name: River bank
definition: The sloping margin of a river, serving to confine it to its natural channel.

name: Aquatic habitat
definition: A habitat that is in or on water.

name: Fen
definition: A freshwater peat land with chemically basic (which roughly means alkaline) ground water.

name: Swamp
definition: A wetland that features permanent inundation of large areas of land by shallow bodies of water, generally with a substantial number of hummocks, or dry-land protrusions.

name: Flood plain
definition: An area which is subject to periodic flooding.

name: Alluvial plain
definition: A relatively flat and gently sloping landform found at the base of a range of hills or mountains, formed by the deposition of alluvial soil over a long period of time by one or more streams coming from the mountains.

name: Lacustrine plain
definition: A plain that originally formed in a lacustrine environment, that is, as the bed of a lake, but from which the water has disappeared, by natural drainage, evaporation or other geophysical processes.

name: Prairie
definition: An area of land of low topographic relief that historically supported grasses and herbs, with few trees, and having generally a mesic (moderate or temperate) climate. Dominated by tall grasses (contrast steppe).

name: Clearing
definition: An open area in a forest.

name: Marine habitat
definition: A habitat that is in or on a sea or ocean containing high concentrations of dissolved salts and other total dissolved solids (typically >35 grams dissolved salts per litre).

name: Brackish water habitat
definition: A habitat that is in or on a body of water (as in estuaries) containing medium concentrations of dissolved salts and other total dissolved solids (typically 0.5 to 35 grams dissolved salts per litre).

name: Soil
definition: Any material within 2 m from the Earth's surface that is in contact with the atmosphere, with the exclusion of living organisms, areas with continuous ice not covered by other material, and water bodies deeper than 2 m.

name: Terrestrial habitat
definition: A habitat that is on or at the boundary of the surface of the Earth.

name: Freshwater habitat
definition: A habitat that is in or on a body of water containing low concentrations of dissolved salts and other total dissolved solids (<0.5 grams dissolved salts per litre).

name: Habitat
definition: The natural environment in which an organism lives, or the physical environment that surrounds (influences and is utilized by) a species population.
attribution: Habitat. (2013, August 9). In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 19:01, August 14, 2013, from http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Habitat&oldid=567783959

name: Basis of Record
definition: The specific nature of the data record - a subtype of the dcterms:type. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Darwin Core Type Vocabulary (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/type-vocabulary/index.htm).

name: Date Identified
definition: The date on which the subject was identified as representing the Taxon. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

name: Latitude
definition: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

name: Longitude
definition: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

name: Establishment Means
definition: The process by which the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence became established at the location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

name: Event Date
definition: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

name: Event Remarks
definition: Comments or notes about the Event.

name: Habitat
definition: A category or description of the habitat in which the Event occurred.

name: Life Stage
definition: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

name: Locality
definition: The specific description of the place. Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country, stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island, islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.

name: Measurement Accuracy
definition: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

name: Measurement Determined By
definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the value of the MeasurementOrFact.

name: Measurement Determined Date
definition: The date on which the MeasurementOrFact was made. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

name: Measurement Method
definition: A description of or reference to (publication, URI) the method or protocol used to determine the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

name: Measurement Remarks
definition: Comments or notes accompanying the MeasurementOrFact.

name: Measurement Type
definition: The nature of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

name: Measurement Unit
definition: The units associated with the measurementValue. Recommended best practice is to use the International System of Units (SI).

name: Measurement Value
definition: The value of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

name: Occurrence Remarks
definition: Comments or notes about the Occurrence.

name: Occurrence Status
definition: A statement about the presence or absence of a Taxon at a Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

name: Sampling Effort
definition: The amount of effort expended during an Event.

name: Sampling Protocol
definition: The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used during an Event.

name: Taxonomic Status
definition: The status of the use of the scientificName as a label for a taxon. Requires taxonomic opinion to define the scope of a taxon. Rules of priority then are used to define the taxonomic status of the nomenclature contained in that scope, combined with the experts opinion. It must be linked to a specific taxonomic reference that defines the concept. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

name: Taxon Rank
definition: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

name: Taxon Remarks
definition: Comments or notes about the taxon or name.

name: Cell shape
definition: The approximate three dimensional shape of a cell, described as one or more geometric solids.

name: Cell volume
definition: Volume of one cell.

name: Coenobium
definition: A colony containing a fixed number of cells, with little or no specialization. They occur in several groups of algae.

name: Filament
definition: (in algae) A string of non-motile cells connected together, sometimes branching (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algae)

name: Wetland Indicator Status (NWPL)
definition: Five indicator statuses, or ratings, are used in the United States National Wetland Plant List to designate a plant species’ preference for occurrence in a wetland or upland: Upland (UPL), Facultative Upland (FACU), Facultative (FAC), Facultative Wetland (FACW), and Obligate Wetland (OBL). The statuses represent the estimated probability of a species occurring in wetlands versus nonwetlands in a region.
attribution: Lichvar, R.W. 2013.   The National Wetland Plant List: 2013 wetland ratings.   Phytoneuron 2013-49: 1-241. http://rsgisias.crrel.usace.army.mil/NWPL/static/cfg/doc/pdl_2013_pub/National/NWPL_Phytoneuron_2013.pdf

name: Facultative Upland
definition: Nonhydrophyte. Usually occur in non-wetlands, but may occur in wetlands.
attribution: Lichvar, R.W. and Minkin, P. 2008. Concepts and procedures for updating the National Wetland Plant List.  U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Engineer Research and Development Center, Cold Regions Research and Engineering Laboratory ERDC/CRREL TN-08-3, http://rsgisias.crrel.usace.army.mil/NWPL/static/cfg/doc/pdl_2013_pub/National/NWPL_Phytoneuron_2013.pdf

name: Upland
definition: Nonhydrophyte. Almost never occur in wetlands.
attribution: Lichvar, R.W. and Minkin, P. 2008. Concepts and procedures for updating the National Wetland Plant List.  U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Engineer Research and Development Center, Cold Regions Research and Engineering Laboratory ERDC/CRREL TN-08-3, http://rsgisias.crrel.usace.army.mil/NWPL/static/cfg/doc/pdl_2013_pub/National/NWPL_Phytoneuron_2013.pdf

name: Facultative
definition: Hydrophyte. Occur in wetlands and non-wetlands.
attribution: Lichvar, R.W. and Minkin, P. 2008. Concepts and procedures for updating the National Wetland Plant List.  U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Engineer Research and Development Center, Cold Regions Research and Engineering Laboratory ERDC/CRREL TN-08-3, http://rsgisias.crrel.usace.army.mil/NWPL/static/cfg/doc/pdl_2013_pub/National/NWPL_Phytoneuron_2013.pdf

name: Facultative Wetland
definition: Hydrophyte. Usually occur in wetlands, but may occur in non-wetlands.
attribution: Lichvar, R.W. and Minkin, P. 2008. Concepts and procedures for updating the National Wetland Plant List.  U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Engineer Research and Development Center, Cold Regions Research and Engineering Laboratory ERDC/CRREL TN-08-3, http://rsgisias.crrel.usace.army.mil/NWPL/static/cfg/doc/pdl_2013_pub/National/NWPL_Phytoneuron_2013.pdf

name: Obligate Wetland

attribution: Lichvar, R.W. and Minkin, P. 2008. Concepts and procedures for updating the National Wetland Plant List. definition: A unit of population density.

name: Decimal degrees
definition: Decimal degrees (DD) express latitude and longitude geographic coordinates as decimal fractions. The values are bounded by ±90° and ±180° respectively. Positive latitudes are north of the equator, negative latitudes are south of the equator. Positive longitudes are east of Prime Meridian, negative longitudes are west of the Prime Meridian. (Wikipedia)

name: Human population density change
definition: Rate of increase in human population density within the geographic range of a species.
attribution: Kate E. Jones, Jon Bielby, Marcel Cardillo, Susanne A. Fritz, Justin O'Dell, C. David L. Orme, Kamran Safi, Wes Sechrest, Elizabeth H. Boakes, Chris Carbone, Christina Connolly, Michael J. Cutts, Janine K. Foster, Richard Grenyer, Michael Habib, Christopher A. Plaster, Samantha A. Price, Elizabeth A. Rigby, Janna Rist, Amber Teacher, Olaf R. P. Bininda-Emonds, John L. Gittleman, Georgina M. Mace, and Andy Purvis. 2009. PanTHERIA: a species-level database of life history, ecology, and geography of extant and recently extinct mammals. Ecology 90:2648. http://esapubs.org/archive/ecol/E090/184/

name: Precipitation in geographic range
definition: Monthly precipitation within the geographic range of a taxon.
attribution: Kate E. Jones, Jon Bielby, Marcel Cardillo, Susanne A. Fritz, Justin O'Dell, C. David L. Orme, Kamran Safi, Wes Sechrest, Elizabeth H. Boakes, Chris Carbone, Christina Connolly, Michael J. Cutts, Janine K. Foster, Richard Grenyer, Michael Habib, Christopher A. Plaster, Samantha A. Price, Elizabeth A. Rigby, Janna Rist, Amber Teacher, Olaf R. P. Bininda-Emonds, John L. Gittleman, Georgina M. Mace, and Andy Purvis. 2009. PanTHERIA: a species-level database of life history, ecology, and geography of extant and recently extinct mammals. Ecology 90:2648. http://esapubs.org/archive/ecol/E090/184/

name: Temperature in geographic range
definition: Monthly temperature within the geographic range of a taxon.
attribution: Kate E. Jones, Jon Bielby, Marcel Cardillo, Susanne A. Fritz, Justin O'Dell, C. David L. Orme, Kamran Safi, Wes Sechrest, Elizabeth H. Boakes, Chris Carbone, Christina Connolly, Michael J. Cutts, Janine K. Foster, Richard Grenyer, Michael Habib, Christopher A. Plaster, Samantha A. Price, Elizabeth A. Rigby, Janna Rist, Amber Teacher, Olaf R. P. Bininda-Emonds, John L. Gittleman, Georgina M. Mace, and Andy Purvis. 2009. PanTHERIA: a species-level database of life history, ecology, and geography of extant and recently extinct mammals. Ecology 90:2648. http://esapubs.org/archive/ecol/E090/184/

name: Actual evapotranspiration rate in geographic range
definition: Monthly AET (Actual Evapotranspiration Rate) within the geographic range of a taxon.  Evapotranspiration (ET) is the sum of evaporation and plant transpiration from the Earth's land surface to atmosphere.
attribution: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Evapotranspiration&oldid=575637212

name: Potential evapotranspiration rate in geographic range
definition: Monthly PET (Potential Evapotranspiration Rate) within the geographic range of a taxon.   Evapotranspiration (ET) is the sum of evaporation and plant transpiration from the Earth's land surface to atmosphere.  Potential evapotranspiration (PET) is a representation of the environmental demand for evapotranspiration and represents the evapotranspiration rate of a short green crop, completely shading the ground, of uniform height and with adequate water status in the soil profile. It is a reflection of the energy available to evaporate water, and of the wind available to transport the water vapour from the ground up into the lower atmosphere.
attribution: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Evapotranspiration&oldid=575637212

name: Days
definition: A day is a unit of time. In common usage, it is an interval equal to 24 hours.[1] It also can mean the consecutive period of time during which the Sun is above the horizon of a location, also known as daytime.  (Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Day&oldid=561991249)

name: Ml/hr O2
definition: Milliliters of oxygen per hour. A unit for metabolic rate.

name: Km^2
definition: Square kilometre, symbol km^2, is a decimal multiple of the SI unit of surface area, the square metre, one of the SI derived units. 1 km^2 is equal to: 1,000,000 m^2, 100 ha (hectare) (Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Square_kilometre&oldid=566625931)

name: Extant
definition: A taxon that is extant is still living today.  A taxon that is not extant is extinct.

name: First Appearance (Earliest Interval)
definition: The earliest interval in which the first appearance of this taxon in the fossil record falls.

name: First Appearance (Latest Interval)
definition: The latest interval in which the first appearance of this taxon in the fossil record falls.

name: Last Appearance (Earliest Interval)
definition: The earliest interval in which the last appearance of this taxon in the fossil record falls.

name: Last Appearance (Latest Interval)
definition: The latest interval in which the last appearance of this taxon in the fossil record falls.

name: First Appearance (Older Bound)
definition: The older bound for the first appearance of this taxon in the fossil record, in Ma.

name: First Appearance (Younger Bound)
definition: The younger bound for the first appearance of this taxon in the fossil record, in Ma.

name: Last Appearance (Older Bound)
definition: The older bound for the last appearance of this taxon in the fossil record, in Ma.

name: Last Appearance (Younger Bound)
definition: The younger bound for the last appearance of this taxon in the fossil record, in Ma.

name: Million years ago
definition: 1 megaannum in the past. Megaannum, Ma. is a unit of time equal to one million (10^6) years.

name: Log10 productivity
definition: The rate of production of reproductive biomass expressed as a log base 10.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Body mass
definition: The amount of matter in the body of an organism.

name: Nest type
definition: The most common nest type used by a species.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Sheltered nest
definition: The nest is placed in sheltered locations, such as caves or under ledges, that are not true cavities.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Cavity
definition: The nest is placed in a cavity with a narrow/protected entrance.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Closed nest
definition: The species builds a closed nest, e.g., domed/oven-shaped nests.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Open cup
definition: Nest type open cup not placed in a cavity.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Foraging Habitat
definition: Primary habitat where the species forages during the breeding season.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Marine habitat (close to the coast)
definition: Marine habitat (close to the coast).
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Freshwater and marine habitat
definition: Freshwater and marine habitat.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Developmental Mode
definition: The developmental mode of young.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Altricial
definition: Parent(s) provide food and thermoregulation (e.g., passerines).
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Semiprecocial
definition:
Parent(s) provide food but not thermoregulation
(e.g., gulls and terns).
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Precocial
definition:
Parent(s) provide neither food nor
thermoregulation (e.g., pheasants and ducks).
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Nonmigratory
definition: Does not make seasonal movements between breeding and wintering grounds.

name: Migratory
definition: Makes seasonal movements between breeding and wintering grounds

name: Foraging time
definition:
Time of day when adults forage during
the breeding season.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Crepuscular
definition: Active at dawn and dusk

name: Parental care
definition: Any behaviour pattern in which a parent invests time or energy in feeding and protecting its offspring.

name: Occasionally breeds cooperatively
definition: The species has been known to breed cooperatively, with nonparents providing care.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Cooperative breeding
definition: The species regularly breeds cooperatively, with nonparents providing care.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Only male provides care
definition: Only the male feeds and nurtures offspring
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Only female provides care
definition: Only the female feeds and nurtures offspring.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Pair provides care
definition: Both parents feed and nurture offspring.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Primary Diet
definition:
Type of food comprising the majority
of the diet of an animal.
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Eats vegetation
definition: Eats plant material other than fruit, nectar, sap, or seeds.

name: Social group
definition: members of social groups contribute to parental care
attribution: Richard M. Sibly, Christopher C. Witt, Natalie A. Wright, Chris Venditti, Walter Jetz, and James H. Brown. 2012.  Energetics, lifestyle, and reproduction in birds.  PNAS 109(27):10937-10941, doi:10.1073/pnas.1206512109

name: Shell length, Bivalve
definition: Length (longest dimension) of the shell of a Bivalve.

name: Shell height, Bivalve
definition: Height (shorter dimension in the plane of the valve) of the shell of a Bivalve.

name: Wingspan
definition: [Distance from one wingtip to the other wingtip.]

name: Metabolic rate
definition: The amount of energy expended at rest

name: Cm3.o2/g/hr
definition: Cubic centimeters of Oxygen consumed per gram body mass per hour.

name: Cell mass
definition: Mass of one cell.

name: Log10 grams
definition: The metric unit of mass (gram) expressed on a logarithmic-scale (base 10).

name: Microphytobenthos
definition: The community of microscopic, unicellular eukaryotic algae (Baccilariophyceae, Chlorophyceae and Dinophyceae) and the  prokaryotic Cyanobacteria which live on sediment surfaces. See Kiel, 2004. The microphytobenthos and its role in aquatic food webs. Dissertation zur Erlangung des Doktorgrades der Mathematisch-Naturwissenschaftlichen Fakultät der Christian-Albrechts-Universität zu Kiel http://epic.awi.de/11852/1/Abe2004e.pdf

name: Interacts with
definition: an organism has an effect on another organism in the community.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecological_interaction

name: Mg
definition: Milligram. A mass unit which is equal to one thousandth of a gram or 10^[-3] g

name: Kg
definition: Kilograms. A mass unit which is equal to the mass of the International Prototype Kilogram kept by the BIPM at Svres, France.

name: Prolate spheroid
definition: A cell shape that approximates a prolate spheroid. (see Hillebrand, H., Dürselen, C.-D., Kirschtel, D., Pollingher, U. and Zohary, T. (1999), BIOVOLUME CALCULATION FOR PELAGIC AND BENTHIC MICROALGAE. Journal of Phycology, 35: 403–424. doi: 10.1046/j.1529-8817.1999.3520403.x)

name: Various
definition: Multiple different cell shapes have been observed for this taxon.

name: µg
definition: A mass unit which is equal to one millionth of a gram or 10^[-6] g.

name: Mean
definition: a mean is the central tendency of a collection of numbers taken as the sum of the numbers divided by the size of the collection.

name: Median
definition: a median is the numerical value separating the higher half of a sample, a population, or a probability distribution, from the lower half.

name: Statistical Method
definition: The method which was used to process an aggregate of values.

name: Source
definition: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

name: Citation
definition: A bibliographic reference for the resource.

name: Mode
definition: a mode is the value that appears most often in a set of data.

name: Min
definition: a minimal value is smallest value of an attribute for the entities in the defined set.

name: Max
definition: a maximal value is largest value of an attribute for the entities in the defined set.

name: Oblate spheroid
definition: A spheroid quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting an equatorial diameter greater than its polar diameter.

name: Sphere
definition: A spheroid quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's resembling a ball (a sphere whose equatorial diameter is equal to the polar diameter).

name: Standard deviation
definition: a standard deviation (represented by the symbol σ) is the quantity of variation from the average (mean, or expected value).

name: Marine pelagic biome
definition: The marine pelagic biome (pelagic meaning open sea) is that of the marine water column, from the surface to the greatest depths.

name: Sterile
definition: A fertility quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being incapable of initiating, sustaining, or supporting reproduction.

name: Increased temperature
definition: A temperature which is relatively high.

name: Medium acidity
definition: A concentration quality inhering in a medium by virtue of the bearer's tendency to hydronate a specific reference base.

name: Acidic
definition: An medium acidity quality inhering in a solution by virtue of the bearer's a high concentration of H+ ions.

name: Alkaline
definition: An medium acidity quality inhering in a solution by virtue of the bearer's a low concentration of H+ ions.

name: Aerobic
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's dependence on oxygen.

name: Anaerobic
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's independence on oxygen.

name: Increased pressure
definition: A pressure which is relatively high.

name: Increased osmolarity
definition: A osmolarity which is relatively high.

name: Radioactive
definition: A radiation quality inhering in bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting or being caused by radioactivity.

name: Dry
definition: A wetness quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's not being covered by a liquid.

name: Frozen
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being kept below its freezing point.

name: Increased quality
definition: A quality that has a value that is increased compared to normal or average.

name: Increased object quality
definition: A quality of an object that has a value that is increased compared to normal or average.

name: Nocturnal
definition: Active during the night

name: Nocturnal/crepuscular, cathemeral, crepuscular or diurnal/crepuscular
definition: An organism that is nocturnal/crepuscular, cathemeral, crepuscular or diurnal/crepuscular

name: Diurnal
definition: Active during the day

name: Forelimb length
definition: The distance from point to point along the longest axis of the anterior/superior jointed appendages used for locomotion or grasping.

name: Body length (VT)
definition: The distance from point to point along the longest axis of the body of an organism.

name: Age at eye opening
definition: Age at which both eyes are fully open after birth.
attribution: Kate E. Jones, Jon Bielby, Marcel Cardillo, Susanne A. Fritz, Justin O'Dell, C. David L. Orme, Kamran Safi, Wes Sechrest, Elizabeth H. Boakes, Chris Carbone, Christina Connolly, Michael J. Cutts, Janine K. Foster, Richard Grenyer, Michael Habib, Christopher A. Plaster, Samantha A. Price, Elizabeth A. Rigby, Janna Rist, Amber Teacher, Olaf R. P. Bininda-Emonds, John L. Gittleman, Georgina M. Mace, and Andy Purvis. 2009. PanTHERIA: a species-level database of life history, ecology, and geography of extant and recently extinct mammals. Ecology 90:2648. http://esapubs.org/archive/ecol/E090/184/

name: Behavioral circadian rhythm
definition: Any measurable or observable behavioral characteristic related to a daily biological activity cycle.

name: Age at first birth
definition: Age at which females give birth to their first litter, or their young attach to teats or hatch out

name: Diet breadth
definition: Number of dietary categories eaten by an organism.

name: Dispersal age
definition: Age at which young permanently leave the parent, parental group, social group or any associated territories.

name: Gestation period duration
definition: The length of time between when a fertilized egg implants in the wall of the uterus and the birth of offspring.

name: Habitat breadth
definition: Number of habitat layers used by an organism

name: Home range
definition: The area within which everyday activities of an animal are typically restricted

name: Inter-birth interval
definition: The length of time between successive births of a female.

name: Clutch/brood/litter size
definition: Single birth offspring quantity.  The proportion or number of offspring produced from a single pregnancy (mammals) or ovulation (fish) or nesting (birds).

name: Litters per year
definition: Number of litters per female per year

name: Total life span
definition: The full period of time from birth to death of an organism.

name: Months
definition: A time unit which is approximately equal to the length of time of one of cycle of the moon's phases which in science is taken to be equal to 30 days.

name: Newborn animal
definition: A neonate. A newborn infant who is only hours, days, or up to a few weeks old.

name: Female
definition: A biological sex quality inhering in an individual or a population that only produces gametes that can be fertilised by male gametes.

name: Male
definition: A biological sex quality inhering in an individual or a population whose sex organs contain only male gametes.

name: Mature
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting complete growth, differentiation, or development.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Merriam-Webster:Merriam-Webster]

name: Animal population density
definition: Number of animals in a population relative to space.

name: Population group size
definition: Number of individuals in a group that spends the majority of their time in a 24 hour cycle together

name: Onset of fertility
definition: The age at which an organism develops the ability to produce live offspring.

name: Social group size
definition: Number of individuals in a group that spends the majority of their time in a 24 hour cycle together where there is some indication that these individuals form a social cohesive unit.

name: Teat number
definition: The number of teats, protuberances on the mammary glands, breasts or udders of female mammals through which milk is excreted.

name: Terrestriality
definition: Degree of terrestriality of an organism.

name: Above ground dwelling
definition: An organism that spends most of its time above ground.

name: Fossorial and/or ground dwelling only
definition: An organism that spends most of its time on the ground or underground.

name: Trophic level
definition: The position an organism occupies in a food chain.

name: Herbivore
definition: An animal that eats mainly plants or parts of plants.

name: Carnivore
definition: An animal that mainly eats meat.

name: Omnivore
definition: An animal that mainly eats all kinds of things, including plants and animals.

name: Weaning age
definition: Age when primary nutritional dependency on the mother ends and independent foraging begins to make a major contribution to the offspring’s energy requirements.

name: Weanling
definition: An animal newly changed to forms of nourishment other than nursing.

name: Geographic range (area)
definition: The total extent of the geographic range of an organism.

name: Latitude
definition: Latitude is a geographic coordinate which refers to the angle from a point on the Earth's surface to the equatorial plane

name: Longitude
definition: Longitude is a geographic position that refers to the angle east or west of a reference meridian between the two geographical poles to another meridian that passes through an arbitrary point.

name: External fertilization
definition: fertilization takes place outside the female's body

name: Internal fertilization
definition: fertilization takes place within the female's body

name: Lecithotrophic
definition: Lecithotrophic larvae are provided with a source of nutrition to use during their dispersal, usually a yolk sac. They generally have greater dispersal potential than direct developers, but short pelagic larval durations relative to planktotrophic larvae.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marine_larval_ecology#Larval_development_strategies

name: Planktotrophic
definition: Planktotrophic species generally have fairly long pelagic larval durations and feed while in the water column. Consequentially, they have the potential to disperse long distances.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marine_larval_ecology#Larval_development_strategies

name: Direct developer
definition: Direct developers are characterized by a larval stage that has very low dispersal potential and usually looks like the adult form of the animal.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marine_larval_ecology#Larval_development_strategies

name: Micrograms per liter
definition: A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in micrograms divided by the volume in liters.

name: Average
definition: A measure of central tendency. A sometimes vague term. It usually denotes the arithmetic mean, but it can also denote the median, the mode, the geometric mean, and weighted means, among other things.
attribution: http://www.stat.berkeley.edu/~stark/SticiGui/Text/gloss.htm#a

name: Reproduction
definition: The production of new individuals that contain some portion of genetic material inherited from one or more parent organisms

name: Fecundity
definition: A reproductive quality inhering in an organism or population by virtue of the bearer's potential reproductive capacity ad measured by the number of gametes.

name: Asexual reproduction
definition: Some members of this lineage are capable of asexual reproduction; offspring arise from a single organism, and inherit the genes of that parent only.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asexual_reproduction

name: Body length (CMO)
definition: A measurement of the longest dimension of a body, typically between two distinct ends of the body.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Dorland:Dorlands_Illustrated_Medical_Dictionary--31st_Ed] [database_cross_reference: ISBN:978-1416049982]

name: Gonochoristic
definition: Having separate sexes throughout life

name: Sequential hermaphrodite
definition: Some members of this lineage are sequential hermaphrodites; they are born as one sex, but can later change into the opposite sex.

name: Juvenile
definition: A maturity quality inhering in a bearer by virtue the bearer's being not fully grown or developed.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: thefreedictionary.com:thefreedictionary.com]

name: Has associate
definition: non specific association. Indicates the biological possibility that two organisms should be considered associates.

name: M^2
definition: An area unit which is equal to an area enclosed by a square with sides each 1 meter long

name: Mm^2
definition: An area unit which is equal to one millionth of a square meter or 10^[-6] m^[2]

name: Standard error
definition: A quantitative confidence value which is the standard deviations of the sample in a frequency distribution, obtained by dividing the standard deviation by the total number of cases in the frequency distribution.

name: Allolectotype
definition: A paralectotype specimen that is the opposite sex of the lectotype. The term is not regulated by the ICZN. [Zoo.]

name: Alloneotype
definition: A paraneotype specimen that is the opposite sex of the neotype. The term is not regulated by the ICZN. [Zoo.]

name: Allotype
definition: A paratype specimen designated from the type series by the original author that is the opposite sex of the holotype. The term is not regulated by the ICZN. [Zoo.]

name: Cotype
definition: A deprecated term no longer recognized in the ICZN; formerly used for either syntype or paratype [see ICZN Recommendation 73E]. [Zoo.]

name: Epitype
definition: An epitype is a specimen or illustration selected to serve as an interpretative type when any kind of holotype, lectotype, etc. is demonstrably ambiguous and cannot be critically identified for purposes of the precise application of the name of a taxon (see Art. ICBN 9.7, 9.18). An epitype supplements, rather than replaces existing types. [Bot./Bio.]

name: Hapantotype
definition: One or more preparations of directly related individuals representing distinct stages in the life cycle, which together form the type in an extant species of protistan [ICZN Article 72.5.4]. A hapantotype, while a series of individuals, is a holotype that must not be restricted by lectotype selection. If an hapantotype is found to contain individuals of more than one species, however, components may be excluded until it contains individuals of only one species [ICZN Article 73.3.2]. [Zoo.]

name: Holotype
definition: The one specimen or other element used or designated by the original author at the time of publication of the original description as the nomenclatural type of a species or infraspecific taxon. A holotype may be 'explicit' if it is clearly stated in the originating publication or 'implicit' if it is the single specimen proved to have been in the hands of the originating author when the description was published. [Zoo./Bot./Bio.]

name: Iconotype
definition: A drawing or photograph (also called 'phototype') of a type specimen. Note: the term "iconotype" is not used in the ICBN, but implicit in, e. g., ICBN Art. 7 and 38. [Zoo./Bot.]

name: Isolectotype
definition: A duplicate of a lectotype, compare lectotype. [Bot.]

name: Isoneotype
definition: A duplicate of a neotype, compare neotype. [Bot.]

name: Isosyntype
definition: A duplicate of a syntype, compare isotype = duplicate of holotype. [Bot.]

name: Isotype
definition: An isotype is any duplicate of the holotype (i. e. part of a single gathering made by a collector at one time, from which the holotype was derived); it is always a specimen (ICBN Art. 7). [Bot.]

name: Lectotype
definition: A specimen or other element designated subsequent to the publication of the original description from the original material (syntypes or paratypes) to serve as nomenclatural type. Lectotype designation can occur only where no holotype was designated at the time of publication or if it is missing (ICBN Art. 7, ICZN Art. 74). [Zoo./Bot.] -- Note: the BioCode defines lectotype as selection from holotype material in cases where the holotype material contains more than one taxon [Bio.].

name: Neotype
definition: A specimen designated as nomenclatural type subsequent to the publication of the original description in cases where the original holotype, lectotype, all paratypes and syntypes are lost or destroyed, or suppressed by the (botanical or zoological) commission on nomenclature. In zoology also called "Standard specimen" or "Representative specimen". [Zoo./Bot./Bio.]

name: Not a Type
definition: For specimens erroneously labelled as types an explicit negative statement may be desirable. [General]

name: Paralectotype
definition: All of the specimens in the syntype series of a species or infraspecific taxon other than the lectotype itself. Also called "lectoparatype". [Zoo.]

name: Paraneotype
definition: All of the specimens in the syntype series of a species or infraspecific taxon other than the neotype itself. Also called "neoparatype". [Zoo.]

name: Paratype
definition: All of the specimens in the type series of a species or infraspecific taxon other than the holotype (and, in botany, isotypes). Paratypes must have been at the disposition of the author at the time when the original description was created and must have been designated and indicated in the publication. Judgment must be exercised on paratype status, for only rarely are specimens explicitly cited as paratypes, but usually as "specimens examined," "other material seen", etc. [Zoo./Bot.]

name: Secondary Type
definition: A referred, described, measured or figured specimen in the original publication (including a neo/lectotypification publication) that is not a primary type. [Zoo.]

name: Supplementary Type
definition: A referred, described, measured or figured specimen in a revision of a previously described taxon. [Zoo.]

name: Syntype
definition: One of the series of specimens used to describe a species or infraspecific taxon when neither a single holotype nor a lectotype has been designated. The syntypes collectively constitute the name-bearing type. [Zoo./Bot.]

name: Topotype
definition: One or more specimens collected at the same location as the type series (type locality), regardless of whether they are part of the type series. Topotypes are not regulated by the botanical or zoological code. Also called "locotype". [Zoo./Bot.]

name: Type
definition: a) A specimen designated or indicated any kind of type of a species or infraspecific taxon. If possible more specific type terms (holotype, syntype, etc.) should be applied. b) the type name of a name of higher rank for taxa above the species rank. [General]

name: Type Information
definition: Information about type specimens or names

name: Water depth
definition: The depth of seawater at a location where this organism has been observed or collected.

name: Water nitrate concentration
definition: Dissolved nitrate concentration in seawater at a location where this organism has been observed or collected.

name: Psu
definition: Practical Salinity Units. The conductivity ratio of a sea water sample to a standard KCl solution. Used to represent salinity.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salinity#Definitions

name: Water temperature
definition: Temperature of the water at a location where this organism has been observed or collected.

name: Water silicate concentration
definition: Dissolved silicate concentration in seawater at a location where this organism has been observed or collected.

name: Water phosphate concentration
definition: Dissolved phosphate concentration in seawater at a location where this organism has been observed or collected.

name: Water dissolved O2 concentration
definition: Dissolved oxygen concentration in seawater at a location where this organism has been observed or collected.

name: Water O2 saturation
definition: The percent oxygen saturation in seawater at a location where this organism has been observed or collected.

name: Has predator
definition: is consumed for energetic or other nutritional needs (by another organism)
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Predation

name: Adolescent
definition: A maturity quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being between the onset of puberty and maturity.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: WordNet:WordNet]

name: Immature
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's lacking complete growth, differentiation, or development.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Merriam-Webster:Merriam-Webster]

name: Larval
definition: A maturity quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's indirect development, undergoing metamorphosis.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Wikipedia:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larval]

name: Neonatal
definition: A maturity quality inhering to a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being at the point or short after birth.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: PATOC:GVG]

name: Pupal
definition: A maturity quality inhering in a insect by virtue of the bearer's being in the chrysalis (cocoon) or post larval stage.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: WordNet:WordNet]

name: Prepupal
definition: A maturity quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being in an inactive stage in the development of some insects, between the larval and the pupal stages.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: WordNet:WordNet]

name: Embryo stage
definition: A life cycle stage that starts with fertilization and ends with the fully formed embryo.

name: Neonate stage
definition: Of or pertaining to the period of time immediately following birth, or to the newborn.

name: Adult
definition: A maturity quality inhering in an individual by virtue of the individual having attained sexual maturity and full growth

name: Fetus
definition: A fetus is a developing mammal or other viviparous vertebrate after the embryonic stage and before birth.
attribution: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fetus

name: Infant
definition: An infant is the very young offspring of a human or animal.

name: Nestling
definition: A young bird or other animal not yet old enough to leave the nest.

name: Late adult stage
definition: Old adult

name: Stillborn
definition: An animal is stillborn when the fetus has died in the uterus.

name: Subadult
definition: An animal in the process of transforming from the juvenile stage to full maturity.

name: Young adult
definition: An animal in the early stages of adulthood

name: Tail length
definition: The distance from point to point along the longest axis of the appendage at the caudal end of the vertebral column.

name: Weight
definition: A physical quality inhering in a bearer that has mass near a gravitational body.

name: Contributor
definition: An entity responsible for making contributions to the resource.

name: Catalog Number
definition: An identifier (preferably unique) for the record within the data set or collection.

name: Collection Code
definition: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived.

name: Institution Code
definition: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

name: Sex
definition: The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

name: Reproductive Condition
definition: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

name: Behavior
definition: A description of the behavior shown by the subject at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

name: Preparations
definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for a specimen.

name: Field Notes
definition: One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of notes taken in the field about the Event.

name: Recorded By
definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original Occurrence. The primary collector or observer, especially one who applies a personal identifier (recordNumber), should be listed first.

name: Identified By
definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the Taxon to the subject.

name: Date Modified
definition: Date on which the resource was changed.

name: Verbatim Latitude
definition: The verbatim original latitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

name: Verbatim Longitude
definition: The verbatim original longitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

name: Verbatim Elevation
definition: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.

name: Cell surface area
definition: Surface area of a cell.

name: Data Quality
definition: Norms, criteria, standards, and other direct qualitative and quantitative measures used in determining the quality or integrity of data; may also include activities and programs intended to assure or improve the quality of data or to review interim data and efficacy outcomes to determine if research should be continued as designed, changed, or terminated; may also include reviews to investigate misconduct in research; levels of excellence which characterize the data based on accepted standards of quality.

name: Sample Size
definition: The size of the sample upon which a measurement is based.

name: Basal metabolic rate
definition: Basal metabolic rate (BMR) is the amount of energy expended daily by humans and other animals at rest. Rest is defined as existing in a neutrally temperate environment while in the post-absorptive state.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Basal_metabolic_rate&oldid=581343469

name: Body temperature
definition: The degree of heat in the body of a living organism, temperature is measure of the average kinetic energy of the particles in a sample of matter, expressed in terms of units or degrees designated on a standard scale.

name: Growth rate
definition: The rate of increase in the size of an organism per unit time.

name: Per day
definition: A frequency rate of occurrences of something within a period of time equal to twenty-four hours.

name: Prenatal development duration
definition: The duration of the development from fertilized,  deposited or implanted egg to hatching/birth.  Corresponds to egg incubation duration in oviparous animals and to gestation period duration in viviparous animals.

name: Initial mortality rate
definition: The initial mortality rate (IMR) represents the mortality rate independently of the ageing process. Though there are different methods, the IMR is typically estimated from the mortality rate prior to its exponential increase with age, which can be obtained from the mortality curve (by looking at the baseline mortality prior to its exponential increase) or, for mice, by using t = 0.25 in the Gompertz equation.
attribution: From senescence.info. Human Ageing Genomic Resources (HAGR). Estimating the Rate of Ageing.  http://genomics.senescence.info/software/demographic.html

name: Mortality Rate Doubling Time
definition: The mortality rate doubling time (MRDT) is considered to be a measure of the rate of ageing.  It is estimated from the slope of the Gompertz curve by: MRDT = 0.693/G  where G is the exponential (Gompertz) mortality rate coefficient.
attribution: From senescence.info. Human Ageing Genomic Resources (HAGR). Estimating the Rate of Ageing.  http://genomics.senescence.info/software/demographic.html

name: Per year
definition: A frequency rate of occurrences of something within a period of time equal to three hundred sixty-five days.

name: Watts
definition: A power unit which is equal to the power used when work is done at the rate of 1 joule per second.

name: Young
definition: An age which is relatively low.

name: Head-body length
definition: Head-body length is the total length from tip of nose to anus or base of tail (i.e. tail length is excluded).
attribution: YouTheria Manual: Head-body length   http://www.utheria.org/head-bodylength.aspx

name: Height standing
definition: The height when maintaining an erect upright position.

name: Dg
definition: Decigrams: The metric unit of mass equal to one-tenth of a gram.

name: Lb
definition: The pound or pound-mass (lb) is a unit of mass used in the imperial, United States customary and other systems of measurement. A number of different definitions have been used, the most common today being the international avoirdupois pound which is legally defined as exactly 0.45359237 kilograms, and which is divided into 16 avoirdupois ounces.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pound_(mass)&oldid=581393690

name: Oz
definition: An ounce (abbreviated oz) is usually the international avoirdupois ounce as used in the United States customary and British imperial systems, which is equal to one sixteenth of a pound or approximately 28 grams.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ounce&oldid=585840842

name: Life cycle habit
definition: Determined for type of life cycle being annual, binneal, perennial etc.

name: Annual
definition: Of plant duration, a plant whose life span ends within one year after germination, e.g. a winter annual germinating in the autumn and flowering in the spring (esp. in Mediterranean climates), approximately synonymous to therophyte, c.f. biennial, ephemeral, perennial, c.f. also of flowering with respect to architecture, hapaxanthic, monocarpic, pleonanthic.
attribution: Stevens, P. F. (2001 onwards). Angiosperm Phylogeny Website. Version 12, July 2012.  Glossary: http://www.mobot.org/mobot/research/apweb/top/glossarya_h.html#annual

name: Biennial
definition: Of life span, a plant which lives for more than one but less than two years after germination, c.f. annual, ephemeral, perennial, of flowering with respect to architecture, hapaxanthic, monocarpic, pleonanthic.
attribution: Stevens, P. F. (2001 onwards). Angiosperm Phylogeny Website. Version 12, July 2012.  Glossary: http://www.mobot.org/mobot/research/apweb/top/glossarya_h.html#biennial

name: Perennial
definition: Of plant duration, a plant whose life span extends over more than two growing seasons, c.f. annual, biennial, ephemeral, of flowering with respect to architecture, hapaxanthic, monocarpic, pleonanthic
attribution: Stevens, P. F. (2001 onwards). Angiosperm Phylogeny Website. Version 12, July 2012.  Glossary: http://www.mobot.org/mobot/research/apweb/top/glossaryi_p.html#perennial

name: Plant growth habit
definition: The general growth form of a plant - its size and branching - also its woodiness.  Some plants have different growth habits depending on environment or location, so a plant can have more than one value.
attribution: Stevens, P. F. (2001 onwards). Angiosperm Phylogeny Website. Version 12, July 2012.  Glossary: http://www.mobot.org/mobot/research/apweb/top/glossarya_h.html#habit

name: Forb/herb
definition: Vascular plant without significant woody tissue above or at the ground. Forbs and herbs may be annual, biennial, or perennial but always lack significant thickening by secondary woody growth and have perennating buds borne at or below the ground surface. In the PLANTS Database (http://plants.usda.gov/), graminoids are excluded but ferns, horsetails, lycopods, and whisk-ferns are included.
attribution: PLANTS Database Growth Habits Codes and Definitions: https://plants.usda.gov/growth_habits_def.html

name: Graminoid
definition: Grass or grass-like plant, including grasses (Poaceae), sedges (Cyperaceae), rushes (Juncaceae), arrow-grasses (Juncaginaceae), and quillworts (Isoetes).
attribution: PLANTS Database Growth Habits Codes and Definitions: https://plants.usda.gov/growth_habits_def.html

name: Lichenous
