definition: Organism generally recognized as a single organism that consists of a fungus and an alga or cyanobacterium living in symbiotic association. Often attached to solid objects such as rocks or living or dead wood rather than soil.
attribution: Modified from PLANTS Database Growth Habits Codes and Definitions: https://plants.usda.gov/growth_habits_def.html

name: Liana
definition: Climbing plant found in tropical forests with long, woody rope-like stems of anomalous anatomical structure.
attribution: PLANTS Database Growth Habits Codes and Definitions: https://plants.usda.gov/growth_habits_def.html

name: Nonvascular
definition: Nonvascular, terrestrial green plant, including mosses, hornworts, and liverworts. Always herbaceous, often attached to solid objects such as rocks or living or dead wood rather than soil.
attribution: PLANTS Database Growth Habits Codes and Definitions: https://plants.usda.gov/growth_habits_def.html

name: Shrub
definition: Perennial, multi-stemmed woody plant that is usually less than 4 to 5 meters (13 to 16 feet) in height. Shrubs typically have several stems arising from or near the ground, but may be taller than 5 meters or single-stemmed under certain environmental conditions.
attribution: PLANTS Database Growth Habits Codes and Definitions: https://plants.usda.gov/growth_habits_def.html

name: Subshrub
definition: Low-growing shrub usually under 0.5 m (1.5 feet) tall, never exceeding 1 meter (3 feet) tall at maturity.
attribution: PLANTS Database Growth Habits Codes and Definitions: https://plants.usda.gov/growth_habits_def.html

name: Tree
definition: Perennial, woody plant with a single stem (trunk), normally greater than 4 to 5 meters (13 to 16 feet) in height; under certain environmental conditions, some tree species may develop a multi-stemmed or short growth form (less than 4 meters or 13 feet in height).
attribution: PLANTS Database Growth Habits Codes and Definitions: https://plants.usda.gov/growth_habits_def.html

name: Vine
definition: Twining/climbing plant with relatively long stems, can be woody or herbaceous.
attribution: PLANTS Database Growth Habits Codes and Definitions: https://plants.usda.gov/growth_habits_def.html

name: Introduced range includes
definition: Lists jurisdictions in which a given organism has been introduced recently.

name: Native range includes
definition: Lists jurisdictions in which a given organism is a member of the undisturbed fauna or flora.

name: Probably native range includes
definition: Lists jurisdictions in which a given organism is probably a member of the undisturbed fauna or flora.

name: Probably introduced range includes
definition: Lists jurisdictions in which a given organism has probably been introduced recently.

name: Areas with native and introduced infra-taxa
definition: Lists jurisdictions in which some infra-taxa of a given organism are members of the undisturbed fauna or flora while others have been introduced recently.

name: Garden persistent range
definition: Lists jurisdictions where a plant persists around gardens and old habitations, is not naturalized.

name: Waif range
definition: Lists jurisdictions where a given organism is an ephemeral introduction, not persistently naturalized

name: Probably waif range
definition: Lists jurisdictions where a given organism is probably an ephemeral introduction, not persistently naturalized

name: Areas with native and probably introduced infra-taxa
definition: Lists jurisdictions in which some infra-taxa of a given organism are members of the undisturbed fauna or flora while others have probably been introduced recently.

name: Invasive/noxious listings
definition: Indicates whether a taxon is listed on a global or regional list of invasive organisms or whether it has special legal status due to its negative impact on human welfare or ecosystems.

name: Us federal noxious weed
definition: The organism is considered a noxious weed under federal US law.  The term ‘‘noxious weed’’ means any plant or plant product that can directly or indirectly injure or cause damage to crops (including nursery stock or plant products), livestock, poultry, or other interests of agriculture, irrigation, navigation, the natural resources of the United States, the public health, or the environment.
attribution:
Section 403 of the US Plant Protection Act (PPA)
http://www.aphis.usda.gov/plant_health/plant_pest_info/weeds/downloads/PPAText.pdf

name: Us federal quarantine
definition: The organism is subject to US federal quarantine notices; i.e., there is a prohibition on its interstate movement from any quarantined area.
attribution: Code of Federal Regulations.  TITLE 7—Agriculture.  PART 301—DOMESTIC QUARANTINE NOTICES.  http://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/text-idx?SID=f7ae28b417dbf1436d3ac3e19c137ba2&node=7:5.1.1.1.2&rgn=div5

name: California Invasive Plant Inventory
definition: Organism is listed in the California Invasive Plant Inventory.  California Invasive Plant Council. 2006. Cal-IPC Publication 2006-02 (February 2007). California Invasive Plant Council. Berkeley, California.  http://www.cal-ipc.org/ip/inventory/index.php

name: Florida Exotic Pest Plant Council Invasive Plant List
definition: Organism is listed in the Florida Exotic Pest Plant Council Invasive Plant List (19 October 1999). Florida Exotic Pest Plant Council. Florida. http://www.fleppc.org/

name: Information Index for Selected Alien Plants in Hawaii
definition: Organism is listed in the Information Index for Selected Alien Plants in Hawai.  USDI, Geological Survey. (20 October 2003). Hawaiian Ecosystems at Risk Project, Biological Resources Division, Haleakala Field Station. Makawao, Hawaii.  http://www.hear.org/

name: Weeds of Kentucky and adjacent states
definition: Organism is listed in Haragan, P.D. 1991. Weeds of Kentucky and adjacent states: a field guide. The University Press of Kentucky. Lexington, Kentucky. 278pp.

name: Weeds of the Northeast
definition: Organism is listed in Uva, R.H., J.C. Neal, & J.M. DiTomaso. 1997. Weeds of the Northeast. Cornell University Press. Ithaca, New York. 397pp.

name: Weeds of Nebraska and the Great Plains
definition: Organism is listed in Stubbendieck, J., G.Y. Friisoe, & M.R. Bolick. 1994. Weeds of Nebraska and the Great Plains. Nebraska Department of Agriculture, Bureau of Plant Industry. Lincoln, Nebraska. 589pp.

name: Invasive exotic pest plants in Tennessee
definition: Organism is listed in the Invasive exotic pest plants in Tennessee (19 October 1999). Southeast Exotic Pest Plant Council. Research Committee of the Tennessee Exotic Pest Plant Council. Tennessee.  http://www.tneppc.org/TNEPPC2004PlantList-8x11.pdf

name: Us State noxious weed lists
definition: Organism is listed in a state noxious weed list. US State agriculture or natural resource departments.  https://plants.usda.gov/java/noxiousDriver

name: Weeds of the United States and Canada
definition: Organism is listed in Southern Weed Science Society. 1998. Weeds of the United States and Canada. CD-ROM. Southern Weed Science Society. Champaign, Illinois.

name: Wisconsin manual of control recommendations for ecologically invasive plants
definition: Organism is listed in Hoffman, R. & K. Kearns (eds.). 1997. Wisconsin manual of control recommendations for ecologically invasive plants. Wisconsin Dept. Natural Resources. Madison, Wisconsin. 102pp.

name: Weeds of the West
definition: Organism listed in Whitson, T.D. (ed.) et al. 1996. Weeds of the West. Western Society of Weed Science in cooperation with Cooperative Extension Services, University of Wyoming. Laramie, Wyoming. 630pp.

name: Threatened or Endangered status
definition: Indicates whether a taxon is listed on a global or regional list of threatened or endangered organisms.

name: Us federal Endangered status
definition: The organism has federal Endangered status in the United States of America.

name: Us federal Threatened status
definition: The organism has federal Threatened status in the United States of America.

name: Active growth period
definition: The growing season of a plant.  The time of year when a plant has its most active growth.

name: Summer
definition: The season between the summer solstice and the autumnal equinox.

name: Winter
definition: The season between the winter solstice and the vernal equinox.

name: Spring
definition: The season between the vernal equinox and the summer solstice.

name: Autumn
definition: The season between the autumnal equinox and the winter solstice.

name: Year round
definition: An activity or period that continues throughout the entire year.

name: After harvest regrowth rate
definition: Indicates the relative rate of regrowth of a herbaceous plant after a harvest of above ground herbage.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Slow
definition: Decreased rate.  A rate which is relatively low.

name: Fast
definition: Increased rate.  A rate which is relatively high.

name: Moderate
definition: Moderate rate.  A rate which is neither relatively high nor low.

name: Livestock bloat potential
definition: The relative potential of an herbaceous plant to cause bloat in livestock.
attribution:
USDA Plants database.  Characteristics Data Fields. 
http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Low
definition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.

name: High
definition: An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.

name: Medium
definition: Mid-way between small and large in number, quantity, magnitude or extent.

name: Carbon-to-nitrogen ratio
definition: The percentage of organic carbon divided by the percentage of total nitrogen in organic material.
attribution: USDA Plants database. Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Low (<23)
definition: The percentage of organic carbon divided by the percentage of total nitrogen in organic material is lower than 23.
attribution: USDA Plants database. Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Medium (23 – 59)
definition: The percentage of organic carbon divided by the percentage of total nitrogen in organic material is 23–59.
attribution: USDA Plants database. Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: High (>59)
definition: The percentage of organic carbon divided by the percentage of total nitrogen in organic material is higher than 59.
attribution: USDA Plants database. Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Horticulture
definition: Horticulture is the art and science of the cultivation of plants

name: Suitable for the coppice method of silviculture
definition: The plant is suitable for the coppice method of silviculture. Coppicing completely removes the canopy of woody plants, cutting them at or just above ground level.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database.  Characteristics Data Fields.  http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not suitable for the coppice method of silviculture
definition: The plant is not suitable for the coppice method of silviculture. Coppicing completely removes the canopy of woody plants, cutting them at or just above ground level.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database.  Characteristics Data Fields.  http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Is not fall conspicuous
definition: The leaves or fruits are not conspicuous during Autumn from a landscaping aesthetics standpoint.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Is fall conspicuous
definition: The leaves or fruits are conspicuous during Autumn from a landscaping aesthetics standpoint.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Fire resistance
definition: The ability of an organism to resist burning.

name: Is fire resistant
definition: Organism resists burning.

name: Is not fire resistant
definition: Organism does not resist burning.

name: Flower color
definition: A flower anatomy and morphology trait (TO:0000499) which is associated with the color of the flower (PO:0009046).

name: Blue
definition: A color hue with low wavelength of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between green and indigo, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 420 to 490 nanometers.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Dictionary:http://dictionary.reference.com/]

name: Brown
definition: A color consisting of dark orange, red, of very low intensity.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Wikipedia:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brown]

name: Green
definition: A color hue with medium-low wavelength of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Dictionary:http://dictionary.reference.com/]

name: Orange
definition: A color hue with high-medium wavelength that of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between red and yellow, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 585 to 620 nanometers.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Wikipedia:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orange]

name: Purple
definition: A color that falls about midway between red and blue in hue.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Dictionary:http://dictionary.reference.com/]

name: Red
definition: A color hue with high wavelength of the long-wave end of the visible spectrum, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 630 to 750 nanometers.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Dictionary:http://dictionary.reference.com/]

name: White
definition: An achromatic color of maximum brightness; the color of objects that reflect nearly all light of all visible wavelengths.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Dictionary:http://dictionary.reference.com/]

name: Yellow
definition: A color hue with medium wavelength of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between orange and green, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 570 to 590 nanometers.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Dictionary:http://dictionary.reference.com/]

name: Flower is not conspicuous
definition: Flowers are not conspicuous from a landscaping aesthetics standpoint.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Flower is conspicuous
definition: Flowers are conspicuous from a landscaping aesthetics standpoint.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Leaf color
definition: A vascular leaf anatomy and morphology trait (TO:0000748) which is associated with the color of leaf (PO:0025034).
attribution: [database_cross_reference: POC:cooperl] [database_cross_reference: GR:pj] [database_cross_reference: PO:0025034]

name: Dark green
definition: Of the color between blue and yellow in the color spectrum; similar to the color of fresh grass
attribution: http://www.vocabulary.com/dictionary/dark-green

name: Gray-green
definition: Of green tinged with grey.
attribution: https://www.vocabulary.com/dictionary/gray-green

name: White-gray
definition: A color between white and black colors, closer to white.

name: Greenish-yellow
definition: Of a color midway between yellow and green

name: Foliage porosity winter
definition: Indicates the porosity (coverage) of the foliage during the winter months.  Foliage porosity is an important factor when trees or shrubs are used as windbreaks for the protection of crops and livestock shelters. Denser (or less porous) foliage allows more wind to pass through.

name: Foliage porosity summer
definition: Indicates the porosity (coverage) of the foliage during the summer months.  Foliage porosity is an important factor when trees or shrubs are used as windbreaks for the protection of crops and livestock shelters. Denser (or less porous) foliage allows more wind to pass through.

name: Porous
definition: A porosity quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being capable of admitting the passage of gas or liquid through pores or interstices.

name: Moderately porous
definition: A porosity quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being incapable of admitting the passage of gas or liquid through pores or interstices.
attribution: cf. http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/PATO_0000973

name: Dense (low porosity)
definition: A porosity quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being incapable of admitting the passage of gas or liquid through pores or interstices.
attribution: cf. http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/PATO_0000973

name: Foliage texture
definition: The general texture of the plant’s foliage relative to other species with the same growth habit, e.g., fine/smooth, medium, coarse/rough.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Rough
definition: A texture quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's irregular surface.

name: Smooth
definition: A texture quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's processing a surface free of roughness or irregularities.

name: Fruit or seed color
definition: The predominant and conspicuous color of the mature fruit or seed from a landscaping aesthetics standpoint.
attribution: USDA Plants database. Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Black
definition: A color that lacks any hues as parts.

name: Fruit/seed is conspicuous
definition: The fruit or seed is conspicuous from a landscaping aesthetics standpoint.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Fruit/seed is not conspicuous
definition: The fruit or seed is not conspicuous from a landscaping aesthetics standpoint.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Primary growth form
definition: The primary growth form on the landscape in relation to soil stabilization on slopes and streamsides. Each plant species is assigned the single growth form that most enhances its ability to stabilize soil.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Bunch
definition: Plant development by intravaginal tillering at or near the soil surface without production of rhizomes or stolons.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Colonizing
definition: A plant that is likely to behave as a colonizer when planted to enhance soil stabilization.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Multiple stems
definition: Plant development by producing two or more stems. Examples: roundleaf dogwood (Cornus rugosa) and red huckleberry (Vaccinium parvifolium).
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Rhizomatous
definition: Plant development by the production of rhizomes which give rise to vegetative spread.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Single crown
definition: A herbaceous plant that develops one persistent base.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Single stem
definition: Plant development by the production of one stem. Examples: corn (Zea mays) and American beech (Fagus grandifolia).
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Stoloniferous
definition: Plant development by the production of stolons which give rise to vegetative spread.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Thicket forming
definition: A plant that is likely to develop thickets when planted to stabilize soil.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Base age
definition: In forestry, the base age, is the reference age for determining a key productivity metric, the site index.  The base age is often set near average rotation length for a species.  The base age is 20 years for trees in temperate areas (>30 degrees north latitude), 10 years for trees in tropical areas (≤30 degrees north latitude), and 10 years for all shrubs and sub-shrubs.
attribution: Weiskittel, A. R., D. W. Hann, J. A. Kershaw, Jr., and J. K. Vanclay.  2011.  Forest Growth and Yield Modeling. Wiley-Blackwell.  -- USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Ft
definition: A foot (plural: feet; abbreviation or symbol: ft or ′ (the prime symbol) is a unit of length. Since 1960 the term has usually referred to the international foot, defined as being one third of a yard, making it 0.3048 meters exactly. It is an integral part of both the imperial and United States customary systems of units. It is subdivided into 12 inches.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Foot_(unit)&oldid=587535236

name: Plant height
definition: A stature and vigor trait (TO:0000133) which is associated with the height of a whole plant (PO:0000003).

name: Geographic distribution
definition: A description of the geographic distribution, or range, of the taxon. Includes descriptions of global, regional, or political aspects of range and whether the taxon is native or introduced in portions of the range and endemicity.

name: Allelopathic effect
definition: This is an assay of any direct or indirect, harmful or beneficial effect of one plant on another through the production of chemical compounds (allelochemicals) that escape in the environment.

name: No known allelopathy
definition: There is no evidence that the organism produces compounds (allelochemicals) that influence the growth, survival, and reproduction of other organisms.

name: Known allelopath
definition: The organism has been shown to produce one or more compounds (allelochemicals) that influence the growth, survival, and reproduction of at least one other organism.

name: Shedability
definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's disposition to lose an entitity by natural process.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: PATOC:GVG]

name: Deciduous
definition: Deciduous (plant):  A quality inhering in a plant by virtue of the bearer's disposition to shed foliage.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: PATOC:cjm]

name: Evergreen
definition: Evergreen (plant): A quality inhering in a plant by virtue of the bearer's disposition to retain foliage.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: PATOC:GVG]

name: Life span
definition: A time quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's expected maximum age.

name: High life span
definition: Increased life span: A life span which is relatively high.

name: Low life span
definition: Decreased life span: A life span which is relatively low.

name: Moderate life span
definition: A life span which is neither relatively low nor relatively high.

name: Grass growth type
definition: The distance of the growing point (terminal meristem) of the vegetative grass tiller to the crown.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Low growing grass
definition: The growing point (terminal meristem) of the vegetative grass tiller remains either at or near the crown.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not a low growing grass
definition: The growing point (terminal meristem) of the vegetative grass tiller does not remain at or near the crown.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Nitrogen fixation
definition: The process in which nitrogen is taken from its relatively inert molecular form (N2) in the atmosphere and converted into nitrogen compounds useful for other chemical processes, such as ammonia, nitrate and nitrogen dioxide.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Wikipedia:Nitrogen_fixation]

name: High  (>160 lb N/acre/year)
definition: Plants with high nitrogen fixation. More than 160 lb nitrogen per acre per year fixed in monoculture.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Medium (85-160 lb N/acre/year)
definition: Plants with medium nitrogen fixation. 85-160 lb nitrogen per acre per year fixed in monoculture.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Low (<85 lb N/acre/year)
definition: Plants with low nitrogen fixation. Less than 85 lb nitrogen per acre per year fixed in monoculture.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Resprout ability after clipping
definition: The ability of woody perennials to resprout following top (above ground biomass) removal.
attribution: BROT trait database. Traits: units and categories (RespClip), http://www.uv.es/jgpausas/brot.htm USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields (Resprout Ability). http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Will resprout
definition: The plant will resprout following top (above ground biomass) removal.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Will not resprout
definition: The plant will not resprout following top (above ground biomass) removal.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Shape
definition: A morphological quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's ratios of distances between its features (points, edges, surfaces and also holes etc).

name: Climbing plant
definition: A plant growing more or less erect by leaning or twining on another structure for support, or by clinging with tendrils.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Glossary_of_botanical_terms&oldid=586835719

name: Columnar
definition: Shaped like a column

name: Conical
definition: A convex 3-D shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's resembling a cone (a 3-D shape with a round cross section that tapers).
attribution: [database_cross_reference: Wikipedia:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cone_(geometry)]

name: Decumbent
definition: A plant with branches growing horizontally but turned up at the ends
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Glossary_of_botanical_terms&oldid=586835719

name: Erect
definition: A positional quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being upright in position or posture.

name: Irregular
definition: Lacking perfect symmetry or evenness.

name: Oval
definition: Ovate: A spheroid quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting a continuous convex surface with an axis of symmetry and one axis longer than the other; egg-shaped.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: PATOC:mc]

name: Prostrate
definition: A positional quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being stretched out and lying at full length along the ground.

name: Rounded
definition: Subcircular: A circular shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being nearly, but not perfectly, circular.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: PATOC:AD]

name: Semi-erect
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being partially upright in position or posture.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: PATOC:GVG]

name: Vase shaped
definition: Shaped like a vase.

name: Human/livestock toxicity
definition: The relative toxicity of an organism to either humans or livestock.

name: Mild
definition: An intensity which is less than moderate in type or degree or effect or force.

name: Moderate
definition: An intensity which is less than extreme in type or degree or effect or force.

name: Severe
definition: An intensity which is extremely bad or unpleasant in type or degree or effect or force.

name: Soil requirements
definition: The soil requirements (texture, moisture, chemistry) needed for a plant to establish and grow.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not adapted to fine textured soils
definition: This plan cannot establish and grow in soil with a fine textured surface layer.  Includes: Sandy clay, Silty clay, Clay.
attribution:
USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html  The soil texture classes are from the Soil Science Society of America, 
http://www.soils.org/. An NRCS team partitioned the soil textures into the three groups, coarse, medium, fine.

name: Adapted to fine textured soils
definition: This plan can establish and grow in soil with a fine textured surface layer.  Includes: Sandy clay, Silty clay, Clay.
attribution:
USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html  The soil texture classes are from the Soil Science Society of America, 
http://www.soils.org/. An NRCS team partitioned the soil textures into the three groups, coarse, medium, fine.

name: Not adapted to medium textured soils
definition: This plan cannot establish and grow in soil with a medium textured surface layer.  Includes: Silt, Sandy clay loam, Very fine sandy loam, Silty clay loam, Silt loam, Loam, Fine sandy loam, Sandy loam, Coarse sandy loam.
attribution:
USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html  The soil texture classes are from the Soil Science Society of America, 
http://www.soils.org/. An NRCS team partitioned the soil textures into the three groups, coarse, medium, fine.

name: Adapted to medium textured soils
definition: This plan can establish and grow in soil with a medium textured surface layer.  Includes: Silt, Sandy clay loam, Very fine sandy loam, Silty clay loam, Silt loam, Loam, Fine sandy loam, Sandy loam, Coarse sandy loam.
attribution:
USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html  The soil texture classes are from the Soil Science Society of America, 
http://www.soils.org/. An NRCS team partitioned the soil textures into the three groups, coarse, medium, fine.

name: Not adapted to coarse textured soils
definition: This plan cannot establish and grow in soil with a coarse textured surface layer.  Includes: Sand, Coarse sand, Fine sand, Loamy coarse sand, Loamy fine sand, Loamy very fine sand, Very fine sand, Loamy sand.
attribution:
USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html  The soil texture classes are from the Soil Science Society of America, 
http://www.soils.org/. An NRCS team partitioned the soil textures into the three groups, coarse, medium, fine.

name: Adapted to coarse textured soils
definition: This plan can establish and grow in soil with a coarse textured surface layer.  Includes: Sand, Coarse sand, Fine sand, Loamy coarse sand, Loamy fine sand, Loamy very fine sand, Very fine sand, Loamy sand.
attribution:
USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html  The soil texture classes are from the Soil Science Society of America, 
http://www.soils.org/. An NRCS team partitioned the soil textures into the three groups, coarse, medium, fine.

name: Anaerobic soil tolerance
definition: The relative tolerance of the plant to anaerobic soil conditions.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: High calcium carbonate tolerance
definition: The plant has relatively high tolerance to calcareous soil. Calcareous soil is defined as soil containing sufficient free CaCO3 and other carbonates to effervesce visibly or audibly when treated with cold 0.1M HCl. These soils usually contain from 10 to almost 1000g/kg CaCO3 equivalent.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Medium calcium carbonate tolerance
definition: The plant has medium tolerance to calcareous soil. Calcareous soil is defined as soil containing sufficient free CaCO3 and other carbonates to effervesce visibly or audibly when treated with cold 0.1M HCl. These soils usually contain from 10 to almost 1000g/kg CaCO3 equivalent.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Low calcium carbonate tolerance
definition: The plant has relatively low tolerance to calcareous soil. Calcareous soil is defined as soil containing sufficient free CaCO3 and other carbonates to effervesce visibly or audibly when treated with cold 0.1M HCl. These soils usually contain from 10 to almost 1000g/kg CaCO3 equivalent.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: No calcium carbonate tolerance
definition: The plant has no tolerance to calcareous soil. Calcareous soil is defined as soil containing sufficient free CaCO3 and other carbonates to effervesce visibly or audibly when treated with cold 0.1M HCl. These soils usually contain from 10 to almost 1000g/kg CaCO3 equivalent.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Germination requirements
definition: The environmental requirements needed for the plant to germinate.

name: Cold stratification not required
definition: Cold stratification does not significantly increasesthe seed germination percentage of this plant.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Cold stratification required
definition: Cold stratification significantly increases the seed germination percentage of this plant.

name: Drought tolerance
definition: Becoming tolerant to drought like conditions of minimal or no water content in the growth environment.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: GR:pj]

name: Low tolerance
definition: decreased tolerance to: A tolerance quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's decreased ability to endure a stimulus.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: PATOC:LC]

name: High tolerance
definition: increased tolerance to: A tolerance quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's increased ability to endure a stimulus.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: PATOC:LC]

name: Medium (normal)
definition: Average.  A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting no deviation from normal or average.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: PATOC:GVG]

name: Calcareous soil tolerance
definition: The relative tolerance of the plant to calcareous soil. Calcareous soil is defined as soil containing sufficient free CaCO3 and other carbonates to effervesce visibly or audibly when treated with cold 0.1M HCl. These soils usually contain from 10 to almost 1000g/kg CaCO3 equivalent.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Primary macronutrient requirements
definition: The relative level of nutrition (N, P, K) required by a plant for normal growth and development.

name: Fire tolerance
definition: The relative ability of a plant to resprout, regrow, or reestablish from residual seed after a fire.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields (Fire tolerance). http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Frost free days
definition: The average number of frost-free days within the plant’s known geographical range. For cultivars, the geographical range is defined as the area to which the cultivar is well adapted rather than marginally adapted.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Hedge tolerance
definition: The relative tolerance of woody perennials to hedging (close cropping) by livestock or wildlife. Herbaceous plants are scored "None” here by default.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Moisture use
definition: Ability to use (i.e., remove) available soil moisture relative to other species in the same (or similar) soil moisture availability region.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Soil pH
definition: The soil pH, of the top 12 inches of soil, within the plant’s known geographical range. For cultivars, the geographical range is defined as the area to which the cultivar is well adapted rather than marginally adapted.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Planting density
definition: Recommended minimum number of individual plants to plant per area.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Acre
definition: A unit of area in British Imperial system named also the international acre. It is equal to 4046.8564224 square meters, or 10 square chains, or 160 square rods, 43560 square feet, or 4840 square yards.

name: Precipitation tolerance
definition: Minimum tolerable rainfall (in inches), expressed as the average annual minimum precipitation that occurs 20% of the time (i.e., the probability of it being this dry in any given year is 20%) at the driest climate station within the known geographical range of the plant. geographical range of the plant. For cultivars, the geographical range is defined as the area to which the cultivar is well adapted rather than marginally adapted.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: In
definition: An inch (plural: inches; abbreviation or symbol: in or ″ – a double prime) is a unit of length in the imperial and United States customary systems of measurement. Historically an inch was also used in a number of other systems of units. Traditional standards for the exact length of an inch have varied in the past, but now the imperial or US customary inch is defined to be exactly 25.4 mm. There are 12 inches in a foot and therefore 36 inches in a yard.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Inch&oldid=585805187

name: Rooting depth
definition: It is calculated from the deepest soil layer where roots were present and the longest root measured in the layer.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: GR:pj] [database_cross_reference: PMID:12582650]

name: Soil depth
definition: The minimum depth of soil required for good growth. Plants that do not have roots such as rootless aquatic plants (floating or submerged) and epiphytes are assigned a minimum root depth value of zero.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Salt tolerance
definition: Tolerance to the high salt content in the growth medium.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: GR:pj]

name: Shade tolerance
definition: The relative tolerance of the plant to shade conditions
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Degrees Fahrenheit
definition: In this scale, the freezing point of water is 32 degrees Fahrenheit and the boiling point is 212 degrees, placing the boiling and freezing points of water 180 degrees apart. -40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to -40 degrees Celsius. A temperature unit which is equal to 5/9ths of a kelvin. Negative 40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to negative 40 degrees Celsius.

name: Temperature tolerance
definition: The minimum tolerable temperature is the lowest temperature recorded in the plant’s historical range. If this is not available, the record low January temperature recorded at climate stations within the current geographical range of the plant is used. This definition does not apply to summer annuals.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Late winter
definition: The late part of the season between the winter solstice and the vernal equinox.

name: Late summer
definition: The late part of the season between the summer solstice and the autumnal equinox.

name: Mid summer
definition: The mid part of the season between the summer solstice and the autumnal equinox.

name: Early summer
definition: The early part of the season between the summer solstice and the autumnal equinox.

name: Late spring
definition: The late part of the season between the vernal equinox and the summer solstice.

name: Mid spring
definition: The mid part of the season between the vernal equinox and the summer solstice.

name: Early spring
definition: The early part of the season between the vernal equinox and the summer solstice.

name: Indeterminate
definition: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

name: Bloom period
definition: The seasonal period in the U.S. during which the plant blooms the most. The bloom period is defined as the time when pollen is shed and stigmas are receptive.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Commercial availability
definition: The availability of plant propagules in the commercial marketplace.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: No known source
definition: The plant is not commercially available.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Routinely available
definition: The plant is routinely available commercially.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Contracting only
definition: The plant is available only through contracting with a commercial grower.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Field collections only
definition: Field collections only, not produced by commercial growers.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Fruit/seed abundance
definition: The amount of seed produced by the plant compared to other species with the same growth habit.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Seed period end
definition: Season in which the latest fruit or seed of the fruit/seed period is visually obvious.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Seed period begin
definition: Season in which the earliest fruit or seed of the fruit/seed period is visually obvious.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Fruit/seed persistence
definition: Are the fruit or seed generally recognized as being persistent on the plant?

name: Fruit/seed is not persistent
definition: The fruit or seed is not persistent on the plant.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Fruit/seed is persistent
definition: The fruit or seed is persistent on the plant.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Plant propagation method
definition: Methods used to produce new plants from a parent plant.

name: Propogated by bare root
definition: It is practical to propagate this plant as a bare root product.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not propogated by bare root
definition: It is not practical to propagate this plant as a bare root product.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Propogated by bulbs
definition: It is practical to propagate this plant as bulbs.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not propogated by bulbs
definition: It is not practical to propagate this plant as bulbs.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Propogated by container
definition: This plant lends itself to being developed as a container product.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not propogated by container
definition: This plant does not lend itself to being developed as a container product.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Propogated by corms
definition: It is practical to propagate this plant as corms.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not propogated by corms
definition: It is not practical to propagate this plant as corms.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Propogated by cuttings
definition: It is practical to propagate this plant as either stem or root cuttings.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not propogated by cuttings
definition: It is not practical to propagate this plant as either stem or root cuttings.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Propogated by seed
definition: It is practical to propagate this plant by seed.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not propogated by seed
definition: It is not practical to propagate this plant by seed.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Propogated by sod
definition: This plant lends itself to being developed as a sod product.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not propogated by sod
definition: This plant does not lend itself to being developed as a sod product.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not propogated by sprigs
definition: It is not practical to propagate this plant by sprigs.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Propogated by sprigs
definition: It is practical to propagate this plant by sprigs.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Propogated by tubers
definition: It is practical to propagate this plant by tubers.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not propogated by tubers
definition: It is not practical to propagate this plant by tubers.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Seeds per pound
definition: The number of seeds per pound in an average seed lot.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Outer ear length
definition: External ear (pinna) length is a standard measurement in mammalogy, usually measured in a living mammal or a fresh mammal carcass. External ear length is measured from the base of the notch at the bottom of the ear to the apex (highest point) of the ear.
attribution: Kristofer Helgen

name: Hind tarsus length
definition: The hind foot length, from heel to toe.
attribution: Darrin Lunde

name: Seed spread rate
definition: The capability of the plant to spread through its seed production compared to other species with the same growth habit.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Seedling survival
definition: The expected seedling survival percentage of the plant compared to other species with the same growth habit.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Grain type
definition: The grain crop classification of a plant.

name: Is a small grain
definition: The plant is a small grain.  A small grain is a cereal (as wheat, oats, barley, rye, rice) having relatively small kernels or sometimes a relatively small plant as distinguished from a plant (as corn) with large kernels or sometimes from a cereal (as sorghum) with a large plant but small kernels or from a similarly cultured and used seed (as soybean) with a relatively small plant and large seeds.
attribution: http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/small%20grain

name: Is not a small grain
definition: The plant is not a small grain.  A small grain is a cereal (as wheat, oats, barley, rye, rice) having relatively small kernels or sometimes a relatively small plant as distinguished from a plant (as corn) with large kernels or sometimes from a cereal (as sorghum) with a large plant but small kernels or from a similarly cultured and used seed (as soybean) with a relatively small plant and large seeds.
attribution: http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/small%20grain

name: Vegetative spread rate
definition: The rate at which this plant can spread compared to other species with the same growth habit.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Uses
definition: The uses of the organism or products derived from the organism.

name: Fuelwood suitability
definition: The relative suitability or potential of a tree or shrub to produce fuelwood. If suitability is unknown, fuelwood potential is expressed in terms of weight (in lbs) per cubic foot of green wood. Relative values correspond to these numerical ranges: Low: <28; Medium: 28-35; High: >35. Plants other than trees and shrubs are left blank here.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Browse animal palatability
definition: The relative palatability of the plant to browsing animals.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Graze animal palatability
definition: The relative palatability of a plant to grazing animals.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Protein potential
definition: The relative protein content of the plant parts that are grazed or browsed by animals.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Suitable as berry/nut/seed product
definition: This woody perennial is suitable  for the commercial production of either berries, nuts, or seeds. Herbaceous plants are scored "not suitable” here by default.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not suitable as berry/nut/seed product
definition: This woody perennial is not suitable  for the commercial production of either berries, nuts, or seeds. Herbaceous plants are scored "not suitable” here by default.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Suitable as Christmas tree product
definition: The plant is known to be suitable for the Christmas tree market.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not suitable as Christmas tree product
definition: The plant is not known to be suitable for the Christmas tree market.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Used as fodder product
definition: The plant is known to be used as animal fodder material. The definition of fodder from the Crop Science Society of America is: Coarse grasses such as corn or sorghum harvested with the seed and leaves green or alive, then cured and fed in their entirety as forage.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not used as fodder product
definition: The plant is not known to be used as animal fodder material. The definition of fodder from the Crop Science Society of America is: Coarse grasses such as corn or sorghum harvested with the seed and leaves green or alive, then cured and fed in their entirety as forage.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Suitable as lumber product
definition: The plant is suitable, or has potential, for use as a commercial lumber producer.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not suitable as lumber product
definition: The plant is not suitable, and has no potential, for use as a commercial lumber producer.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Suitable for naval store products
definition: This woody perennial is suitable for production of naval store products. Navel Store Products are defined as tar, pitch, turpentine, pine oil, rosin, and terpenes obtained from pine and other coniferous trees. Herbaceous plants are scored "not suitable” here by default.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not suitable for naval store products
definition: This woody perennial is not suitable for production of naval store products. Navel Store Products are defined as tar, pitch, turpentine, pine oil, rosin, and terpenes obtained from pine and other coniferous trees. Herbaceous plants are scored "not suitable” here by default.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Suitable as nursery stock product
definition: This plant is suitable for production of nursery stock.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not suitable as nursery stock product
definition: This plant is not suitable for production of nursery stock.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Berries, nuts, seeds, or fruits palatable to humans
definition: The plant produces berries, nuts, seeds, or fruits that are palatable to humans.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: No berries, nuts, seeds, or fruits palatable to humans
definition: The plant does not produce berries, nuts, seeds, or fruits that are palatable to humans.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Suitable as post product
definition: The tree or shrub is commonly used or has high potential for the production of posts, poles, mine timbers, or railroad ties. Plants other than trees and shrubs are scored “not suitable” here by default.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not suitable as post product
definition: The tree or shrub is not commonly used and does not have high potential for the production of posts, poles, mine timbers, or railroad ties. Plants other than trees and shrubs are scored “not suitable” here by default.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Suitable as pulpwood product
definition: The woody perennial is commonly used or has high potential to be used for the production of pulpwood. Herbaceous plants are scored "not suitable" here by default.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not suitable as pulpwood product
definition: The woody perennial is not commonly used and does not have high potential to be used for the production of pulpwood. Herbaceous plants are scored "not suitable" here by default.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Suitable as veneer product
definition: The tree is commonly used or has high potential to be used for commercial veneer or plywood. Plants other than trees are scored “not suitable” here by default.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Not suitable as veneer product
definition: The tree is not commonly used and does not have high potential to be used for commercial veneer or plywood. Plants other than trees are scored “not suitable” here by default.
attribution: USDA PLANTS database Characteristics Data Fields. http://plants.usda.gov/charinfo.html

name: Head to coccyx length
definition: The distance from the head to the caudal vertebrae in the coccygeal region.

name: Water salinity
definition: Dissolved salt concentration in seawater at a location where this organism has been observed or collected.

name: Percent
definition: A dimensionless ratio unit which denotes numbers as fractions of 100.

name: 5th percentile
definition: The 5th percentile is the value (or score) below which 5 percent of the observations are found.

name: Human population density
definition: The human population density within the geographic range of a taxon.

name: Terrestrial and marine habitat
definition: Terrestrial and marine habitat

name: Terrestrial and freshwater habitat
definition: Terrestrial and freshwater habitat

name: Ubiquitous
definition: This organism is present in all or substantially all habitat categories

name: Plant spacing
definition: The space/row width needed by an individual plant in cultivation.

name: Number of Genetic Transcripts
definition: Number of detected transcripts that match recognized genetic sequences from well known repositories such as GenBank, UniProt, etc.

name: Acid glade
definition: A gap or clearing in a forest with acidic soil.

name: Bluff
definition: A very steep and broad hill or small cliff, frequently next to a river or ocean.
attribution: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bluff

name: Woody
definition: A woody plant is a plant that produces wood as its structural tissue. Woody plants are usually either trees, shrubs, or lianas. These are usually perennial plants whose stems and larger roots are reinforced with wood produced from secondary xylem.
attribution: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Woody_plant&oldid=578298866

name: Short-lived perennial
definition: A perennial plant that lives only a few years, as opposed to long-lived perennials that persist for many years or even decades.

name: Fern
definition: A fern is any one or more of a group of roughly 12,000 species of plants belonging to the botanical group known as Pteridophyta.
attribution: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Fern&oldid=590843354

name: Number of DNA Records In GGBN
definition: number of DNA records in this clade in the Global Genome Biodiversity Network (GGBN) repository of genome quality tissues.

name: Submergence tolerance
definition: Measure of tolerance of a plant to submergence condition.

name: Extinct in the wild
definition:
A taxon is Extinct in the Wild when it is known only to survive in cultivation, in captivity 
or as a naturalized population (or populations) well outside the past range. A taxon is 
presumed Extinct in the Wild when exhaustive surveys in known and/or expected habitat, 
at appropriate times (diurnal, seasonal, annual), throughout its historic range have failed 
to record an individual. Surveys should be over a time frame appropriate to the taxon’s 
life cycle and life form.
attribution: http://www.iucnredlist.org/technical-documents/categories-and-criteria

name: Extinct
definition:
A taxon is Extinct when there is no reasonable doubt that the last individual has died. A 
taxon is presumed Extinct when exhaustive surveys in known and/or expected habitat, 
at appropriate times (diurnal, seasonal, annual), throughout its historic range have failed 
to record an individual. Surveys should be over a time frame appropriate to the taxon’s 
life cycle and life form.
attribution: http://www.iucnredlist.org/technical-documents/categories-and-criteria

name: Critically endangered
definition:
A taxon is Critically Endangered when the best available evidence indicates that it meets 
any of the criteria A to E for Critically Endangered, and it is therefore considered to be facing an extremely high risk of extinction in the wild
attribution: http://www.iucnredlist.org/technical-documents/categories-and-criteria

name: Endangered
definition:
A taxon is Endangered when the best available evidence indicates that it meets any of the 
criteria A to E for Endangered, and it is therefore considered to be facing a very high risk of extinction in the wild.
attribution: http://www.iucnredlist.org/technical-documents/categories-and-criteria

name: Vulnerable
definition:
A taxon is Vulnerable when the best available evidence indicates that it meets any of the 
criteria A to E for Vulnerable, and it is therefore considered to be facing a high risk of extinction in the wild.
attribution: http://www.iucnredlist.org/technical-documents/categories-and-criteria

name: Near threatened
definition:
A taxon is Near Threatened when it has been evaluated against the criteria but does not 
qualify for Critically Endangered, Endangered or Vulnerable now, but is close to qualifying 
for or is likely to qualify for a threatened category in the near future.
attribution: http://www.iucnredlist.org/technical-documents/categories-and-criteria

name: Least concern
definition:
A taxon is Least Concern when it has been evaluated against the criteria and does not 
qualify for Critically Endangered, Endangered, Vulnerable or Near Threatened. Widespread 
and abundant taxa are included in this category.
attribution: http://www.iucnredlist.org/technical-documents/categories-and-criteria

name: Data deficient
definition:
A taxon is Data Deficient when there is inadequate information to make a direct, or indirect, assessment of its risk of extinction based on its distribution and/or population status. A taxon in this category may be well studied, and its biology well known, but appropriate data on abundance and/or distribution are lacking. Data Deficient is therefore 
not a category of threat. Listing of taxa in this category indicates that more information is 
required and acknowledges the possibility that future research will show that threatened 
classification is appropriate. It is important to make positive use of whatever data are available. In many cases great care should be exercised in choosing between DD and a threatened status. If the range of a taxon is suspected to be relatively circumscribed, and a considerable period of time has elapsed since the last record of the taxon, threatened status may well be justified.
attribution: http://www.iucnredlist.org/technical-documents/categories-and-criteria

name: Not evaluated
definition: A taxon is Not Evaluated when it has not yet been evaluated against the IUCN criteria.
attribution: http://www.iucnredlist.org/technical-documents/categories-and-criteria

name: Extant
definition: This taxon is still in existence, as opposed to extinct.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extant_taxon

name: Extant and fossil
definition: This taxon has descendants that are extant lineages and others that are extinct or fossil taxa.

name: January
definition: The first month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: February
definition: The second month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: March
definition: The third month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: April
definition: The fourth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: December
definition: The twelfth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: November
definition: The eleventh month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: October
definition: The tenth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: September
definition: The ninth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: August
definition: The eighth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: July
definition: The seventh month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: June
definition: The sixth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: May
definition: The fifth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar.

name: Seed per unit
definition: The number of seeds per unit in an average seed lot.

name: Periphyton
definition: Periphyton is a complex mixture of algae, cyanobacteria, heterotrophic microbes, and detritus that are attached to submerged surfaces in most aquatic ecosystems

name: Magenta
definition: A color consisting of red and blue hues. [database_cross_reference: Wikipedia:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magenta]

name: Cyan
definition: A color consisting of green and blue hue. [database_cross_reference: PATOC:GVG]

name: References in BHL?
definition: this clade is represented in the literature in the Biodiversity Heritage Library (BHL)

name: Number of references in BHL
definition: number of references to taxa in this clade in the Biodiversity Heritage Library

name: Number of records in BOLD
definition: number of records for taxa in this clade in the Barcode of Life Database (BOLD)

name: Records in BOLD?
definition: this clade is represented by geo-referenced data in the Barcode of Life Database (BOLD)

name: Caudal fin shape
definition: Any measurable or observable characteristic related to the shape of a caudal fin.

name: Bifurcated
definition: A branched quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being divided into two branches.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: thefreedictionary.com:thefreedictionary.com]

name: Bilobed
definition: A lobed quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being divided into or having two lobes.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: thefreedictionary:http://www.thefreedictionary.com/bilobed]

name: Blunt
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's terminating gradually in a rounded end.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: ISBN:0881923214]

name: Circular
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being such that every part of the surface or the circumference is equidistant from the center.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: thefreedictionary.com:thefreedictionary.com]

name: Elongated
definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's length being notably higher than its width.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: WordNet:WordNet]

name: Emarginate
definition: A notched shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having a notched tip or edge.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: url:http://www.thefreedictionary.com/emarginate]

name: Lanceolate
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being shaped like a lance-head, considerably longer than wide, tapering towards the tip from below the middle; attached at the broad end.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: PATOC:GVG]

name: Lobed
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being partly divided into a determinate number of regions.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: ISBN:0881923214]

name: Truncated
definition: A shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's terminating abruptly by having or as if having an end or point cut off.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: thefreedictionary.com:thefreedictionary.com]

name: U-shaped
definition: A concave 3-D shape quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being shaped in the form of the letter U.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: WordNet:WordNet

name: Conservation dependent
definition: The category is part of the IUCN 1994 Categories & Criteria (version 2.3), which is no longer used in evaluation of taxa, but persists in the IUCN Red List for taxa evaluated prior to 2001. It was assigned to species or lower taxa which were dependent on conservation efforts to prevent the taxon becoming threatened with extinction.
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conservation_Dependent

name: Number of public records in BOLD
definition: number of records in this clade in the Barcode Of Life Database (BOLD)

name: Bioluminescent
definition: Has this organism been observed to produce and transmit light?
attribution: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bioluminescence

name: Not invasive in
definition: Information about the jurisdictions where the taxon is considered to be an invasive organism due to its negative impact on human welfare or ecosystems.

name: Invasive in
definition: Information about the jurisdictions where the taxon is considered to be an invasive organism due to its negative impact on human welfare or ecosystems.

name: Usda Forest Service Fire Effects Information System - Invasive Species
definition: Organism is listed in the USDA Forest Service Fire Effects Information System Invasive Species list.
attribution: http://www.feis-crs.org/beta/faces/SearchByOther.xhtml

name: Usda Forest Service Fire Effects Information System - Not Invasive
definition: Organism is listed in the USDA Forest Service Fire Effects Information System Invasive Species list.
attribution: http://www.feis-crs.org/beta/faces/SearchByOther.xhtml

name: Noxious Weed List for Australian States and Territories
definition: Organism is listed in the Noxious Weed List for Australian States and Territories.  Australian Weeds Committee.  2012. Noxious Weed List for Australian States and Territories. Version 26b.00. http://www.weeds.org.au/docs/weednet6.pdf

name: Weeds of National Significance (Australia)
definition: Organism is listed as a Weed of National Significance (WoNS) by Australian governments based on its invasiveness, potential for spread and environmental, social and economic impacts. http://www.environment.gov.au/biodiversity/invasive/weeds/weeds/lists/wons.html

name: National Environmental Alert List (Australia)
definition: Organism is listed in the Australian National Environmental Alert List, a list of plant species that are in the early stages of establishment and have the potential to become a significant threat to biodiversity if they are not managed.  http://www.environment.gov.au/biodiversity/invasive/weeds/weeds/lists/alert.html

name: Shoot:root ratio (SRR)
definition: The quotient of the dry weight of the shoots produced during a given growth period divided by the dry weight of the roots esp. for crop plants.
attribution: http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/shoot-root%20ratio

name: Leaf shape
definition: A leaf anatomy and morphology trait (TO:0000748) which is associated with the variation in shapes and forms of a leaf (PO:0025034).
attribution: [database_cross_reference: POC:cooperl] [database_cross_reference: GR:pj] [database_cross_reference: PO:0025034]

name: Leaf area
definition: A leaf anatomy and morphology trait (TO:0000748) which is associated with the total area of a leaf (PO:0025034).
attribution: [database_cross_reference: POC:cooperl] [database_cross_reference: GR:pj] [database_cross_reference: PO:0025034]

name: Bud source
definition: Location of bud bank for resprouting.
attribution: BROT trait database. Traits: units and categories (BudSource), http://www.uv.es/jgpausas/brot.htm

name: Seed bank longevity
definition: Period during which seeds remain viable in the (soil or canopy) seed bank.
attribution: BROT trait database. Traits: units and categories, http://www.uv.es/jgpausas/brot.htm

name: Seed bank
definition: Location of persistent seed bank (longevity > 1 yr).
attribution: BROT trait database. Traits: units and categories (SeedBank), http://www.uv.es/jgpausas/brot.htm

name: Post-fire seedling emergence
definition: Seedling density per pre-fire mature individuals emerging during the first year after fire (seedlings/mature).
attribution: BROT trait database. Traits: units and categories (SeedlEmerg), http://www.uv.es/jgpausas/brot.htm

name: Post-fire seedling survival
definition: Proportion of seedlings surviving first dry season after fire.
attribution: BROT trait database. Traits: units and categories (SeedlSurv), http://www.uv.es/jgpausas/brot.htm

name: Age at maturity of resprouts
definition: Age of resprouts at first successful reproduction (in years), i.e., when most of the resprouting plants produce the first seed crop.
attribution: BROT trait database. Traits: units and categories (MatResp), http://www.uv.es/jgpausas/brot.htm

name: Age at maturity
definition: Age at the first successful reproduction.

name: Sapling
definition: A young tree; specifically: one not over four inches in diameter at breast height.

name: Wood density
definition: Secondary xylem volumetric density. Any measurable or observable characteristic related to the volumetric density of a secondary xylem.
attribution: [database_cross_reference: GOC:TermGenie] [database_cross_reference: http://dx.doi.org/10.1111/j.1461-0248.2009.01285.x]

name: Pelvic fin
definition: Form of the pelvic fin; may be fused, partially fused, or divided.
attribution: http://www.coralreeffish.com/gobiidae.html

name: Divided
definition: The pelvic fins on the right and left are completely separate, with the base of the innermost fin ray clearly separated by a space from the base of the ray on the other side. This state is typical of most fishes.
attribution: http://www.coralreeffish.com/gobiidae.html

name: Fused
definition: Pelvic fins are completely fused along the length of the rays; this is the most common condition among the larval gobies. There can be a frenum, or anterior connecting band, joining the outermost pelvic-fin spines on the two sides to form a cup-shaped fin.
attribution: http://www.coralreeffish.com/gobiidae.html

name: Partial
definition: The right and left pelvic fins are partially divided, leaving the proximal innermost fin rays still fused.
attribution: http://www.coralreeffish.com/gobiidae.html

name: Anal fin elements
definition: Number of elements or segments in the anal fin.
attribution: http://www.coralreeffish.com/gobiidae.html

name: Spines, first dorsal fin
definition: Number of spines in the first dorsal fin
attribution: http://www.coralreeffish.com/gobiidae.html

name: Pouch young
definition: The offspring of a marsupial mammal during the pouch-bound phase of life.

name: Suffrutescent
definition: of habit, a plant with a herbaceous upper part and woody lower part.
attribution: http://www.mobot.org/mobot/research/apweb/top/glossaryq_z.html#S

name: Epiphyte
definition: A plant growing on, but not parasitic on, another plant.
attribution: http://www.mobot.org/mobot/research/apweb/top/glossarya_h.html#E

name: Seed mass
definition: The dry weight of seeds (including some single-fruited seeds such as achenes or caryopsis).
attribution: BROT trait database. Traits: units and categories (SeedMass), http://www.uv.es/jgpausas/brot.htm;

name: Fruit type
definition: A fruit anatomy and morphology trait (TO:0002629) which is associated with the type of a fruit (PO:0009001).
attribution: [database_cross_reference: PO:0009001] [database_cross_reference: TO:moorel]

name: Propagule
definition: The dispersal unit for sexual regeneration.
attribution: BROT trait database. Traits: units and categories (Propagule), http://www.uv.es/jgpausas/brot.htm;

name: Dispersal vector
definition: A dispersal vector is an agent transporting seeds or other dispersal units.  Dispersal vectors may include biotic factors, such as animals, or abiotic factors, such as the wind or the ocean.
attribution: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dispersal_vector&oldid=551654371

name: Germinative response to heat stimuli
definition: The most intense heat treatment (i.e., seed exposition to dry heat >= 50ºC), of those tested (see Measurement Method), that significantly increases the seed germination response of the plant versus the control. For studies where differences were not statistically tested, the criteria in Paula & Pausas (2008) are used. Three heat intensities are considered: Low (<100ºC for <= 5min), Moderate (<100ºC for > 5min or >= 100ºC for <= 5min), High (>= 100ºC for >5min) or unknown (unk).  Note that in many studies, post-treatment seed viability is not considered or not specified in the original reference, and thus it can lead to misinterpretation of treatment effects.
attribution: BROT database, Traits: units and categories: Heat-Stimulated Germination (HeatStimGerm)

name: Violet
definition: A color hue with very low wavelength of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between reddish blue or bluish purple, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 420 to 380 nanometers.

name: Orangish-red
definition: A color with a hue between that of red and orange, with a hue value between 0° and 30°.
attribution: Wright C. and Seltmann, K.C.  Color representation of blue flowers by Encyclopedia of Life content providers.The Biodiversity Data Journal (In prep) 2014

name: Reddish-orange
definition: A color with a hue between that of red and orange, with a hue value between 0° and 30°.
attribution: Wright C. and Seltmann, K.C.  Color representation of blue flowers by Encyclopedia of Life content providers.The Biodiversity Data Journal (In prep) 2014

name: Yellow orange
definition: A color consisting of yellow and orange hue.

name: Yellow green
definition: A color consisting of yellow and green hues.

name: Greenish-blue
definition: A color with a hue between that of green and blue, with a hue value between 120° and 240° .
attribution: Wright C. and Seltmann, K.C.  Color representation of blue flowers by Encyclopedia of Life content providers.The Biodiversity Data Journal (In prep) 2014

name: Bluish-green
definition: A color with a hue between that of blue and green, with a hue value between 120° and 240°.
attribution: Wright C. and Seltmann, K.C.  Color representation of blue flowers by Encyclopedia of Life content providers.The Biodiversity Data Journal (In prep) 2014

name: Bluish-purple
definition: A color with a hue between that of blue and purple, with a hue value between 240° and 300°.
attribution: Wright C. and Seltmann, K.C.  Color representation of blue flowers by Encyclopedia of Life content providers.The Biodiversity Data Journal (In prep) 2014

name: Purplish-blue
definition: A color with a hue between that of purple and blue, with a hue value between 240° and 300°.
attribution: Wright C. and Seltmann, K.C.  Color representation of blue flowers by Encyclopedia of Life content providers.The Biodiversity Data Journal (In prep) 2014

name: Purplish-red
definition: A color with a hue between that of purple and red, with a hue value between 300° and 360°.
attribution: Wright C. and Seltmann, K.C.  Color representation of blue flowers by Encyclopedia of Life content providers.The Biodiversity Data Journal (In prep) 2014

name: Reddish-purple
definition: A color with a hue between that of red and purple, with a hue value between 300° and 360°.
